characters: GRAVE LOOKING SCIENTIST. A DISTRAUGHT VOX POP. A CONVOY O

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Last orders please. Close up on the face of a MAN. He draws on his cigarette. WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) Shaun? SHAUN stares blankly into space.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah... WOMAN'S VOICE (CONT’D) Do you see what I’m saying?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah, totally. We reveal that SHAUN is sitting with a woman, LIZ. They a both in their late twenties. LIZ looks slightly concerned SHAUN looks slightly confused. They are having a drink.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t feel so responsible.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I know he’s your best friend but you do live with him.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: It’s not that I don’t like Ed. (speaks off to her right) Ed, it’s not that I don’t like you.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: S’alright. We reveal ED right next to them, playing a horror themed FRUIT MACHINE which bleeps spooky electronic noises. He i his late twenties and slightly overweight.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: It'd just be nice if we could-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (hits the fruit machine) Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: -spend a bit more time together-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Bollocks!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: -just the two of us-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Cock it!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: We have a laugh don’t we?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah... SHAUN and LIZ smile, sharing some private joke. SHAUN relaxes, momentarily off the hook. But...

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: But with Ed always here, it’s no wonder I end up bringing my flatmates out. Then that only exacerbates things.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Well, you guys hardly get on do you?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No, what does exacerbate mean?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: It means ‘to make things worse’.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh right. Look, it’s not that I don’t like David and Di. (speaks off to his right) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, it’s not that I don’t like you...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID DIANNE
dialogues.text: That’s alright. That’s alright. We reveal DAVID and DIANNE, sitting next to LIZ. Both in their late twenties, DAVID is trendy but straight-laced, is colourful and chirpy. They hold hands.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And it’s not that I don’t want to spend time with you because I do. It’s just, Ed doesn’t really have too many friends-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Can I get any of you cunts a drink? SHAUN closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anybody?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID DIANNE
dialogues.text: No thanks. No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I’m fine thanks, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Pint Shaun? SHAUN nods. ED holds out his palm to SHAUN, who sighs and reluctantly hands him a fiver. Meanwhile, DAVID steps in.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I know friends are important Shaun, but you've got to set aside quality time for just the two of you. I know I would, if I was Lizzy’s boyfriend. DAVID looks at LIZ with affection, as DIANNE chips in.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Or get out more. Daffs is always taking me out to see his listed buildings, I’m always dragging him to the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’m not so hot on theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took my students to see this great new play about incest. Very cool. Lots of swearing.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: He’s not so hot on theatre.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Well, how about a nice meal? You could go to that restaurant me and Daffs go to. The place that does all the fish. It’s your anniversary soon isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It was last week.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Oh, so did you do anything special?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: We came here.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah, but that was just me and you.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: And Ed.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: He wasn’t with us.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: He was sitting at the bar. It’s not the same.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shauny, hog lumps! A packet of Pork Scratchings hits SHAUN square in the fac

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun, what I’m trying to say is, I need something a little more. SHAUN offers her a Pork Scratching. She declines.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: More than spending every night in the Winchester. I mean, I’m 29. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’ve got things I want to do with my life, I want to get out there, do more interesting stuff, live a little, but I’d love to be able to do it with you, but I want you to want to want to do it too. LIZ laughs grimly at her own silly sentence. She then tak pork scratching and regards SHAUN with a mixture of exasperation and affection.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go on at you, Jesus, listen to me. I’m beginning to sound like your Mum. Not that I’d know what she sounds like.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You still haven’t met his Mum?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Not Yet.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you haven’t met his mum.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: It’s not that simple.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Don’t you get along with your Mum, Shaun?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s not that I don’t get along with her-

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Are you ashamed of your Mum, Shaun?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No I’m not, I love my Mum.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (returning with drinks) I love his Mum.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: She’s butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shaun-

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Shaun-

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guys-

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun-

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Liz (holds up his hands) I totally understand what you’re saying and I agree, really I do. We should get out there. Do more interesting stuff. Together. We’1ll start tomorrow, I’1ll book a restaurant. The place that does all the fish. We’ll do it properly. Just the two of us. Things’1l change. Promise.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Really Shaun? The LANDLORD calls time. SHAUN stares back into space.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shaun? The BELL rings again. The SPOOKY NOISES continue as...

dialogues.speaker: TITLES BEGIN
dialogues.text: A MONTAGE OF GREATER LONDON, Saturday 8 A.M. (All actions the sequence are choreographed to the TITLE MUSIC) ...A traffic jam. Drivers stare blankly ahead. A MIDDLE A MAN sits in a Jag wearing DRIVING GLOVES... ...A bus stop. BORED COMMUTERS ignore each other... ...A vast supermarket car park. Customers park up as a bo tied OLD MAN slowly collects discarded trolleys... ...A 24 hour supermarket serves earlybird customers. A va CHECKOUT GIRL bleeps products through her till...  ...A nightclub in an industrial estate expels its last patrons. DAZED YOUNG CLUBBERS wander into the daylight... ...A nondescript suburb. A BORED KID kicks a FOOTBALL aga a wall. We CLOSE IN on a semi-detached house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare feet shuffle into shot. Slowly we PAN UP to see- SHAUN. Dead to the world. His face tired. He yawns. We are in the lounge. The decor is male, the room untidy. is sitting on the sofa, playing a video game. He may have been there all night. SHAUN sits next to him, picks up a game controller and presses a button. A VOICE booms.

dialogues.speaker: GAME VOICE
dialogues.text: Player two has entered the game.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Haven’t you got work? SHAUN puts the controller back down.

dialogues.speaker: GAME VOICE
dialogues.text: Player two has left the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOILET is flushed...a SHOWER run...TEETH brushed... SHAUN now wears a white short-sleeved shirt. He straighte his tie in the mirrored door of the bathroom cabinet, whi is ajar. He shuts it. PETE stands in the reflection. His face like thunder.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You do know the front door was open again last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DRAWER is yanked open...A KNIFE grabbed...TOAST buttere BOTTLE OF MILK hits the table. PETE screws the lid on.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I’m not saying it was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know man but-

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I’m saying it was Ed.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Right. PETE returns the milk to its rightful place in the fridge also wears a shirt and tie, but is somewhat smarter.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I can’t live like this. Look at the state of it. We’re not students anymore.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Pete-

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: It’s not like he even brings any real money into the house.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: He brings a bit.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: What, dealing drugs?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Come on. He sells a bit of weed every now and again. You’ve sold puff.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Once! At college! To you! Anyway, I did a lot of stupid things at college Shaun. I dressed up as Frank N. Furter, I drank snakebite and black, I slept with a fat girl. Doesn’t mean I want to do any of them for a living.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Look I’ve known him since primary school. I like having him around. He’s a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: What because he can impersonate an orangutan? Fuck-a-doodle-doo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: He’s dead weight Shaun.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Okay, I admit, he can be pretty funny on occasion. I had a great time that night we sat up drinking Apple Schnapps and playing Tekken

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah, when was that?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Five years ago. When is he going home?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Whassup niggaz? ED enters and takes the milk from the fridge, he swigs fr the bottle and wanders out, scratching his nuts.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’1l have a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN sits down by ED, who is again playing the video gam PETE watches at the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Hey man, listen...top left...

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: ...I was just going to say...reload!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I’m on it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: ...Since you’re...ooh nice shot.  10.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Since you’re in most of the day- ED’s mobile rings (ring tone: ‘HALLOWEEN’ ).

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Two seconds. (answers ) Alright Noodle...No I only got an ‘enry. Shortage on...Alright. Laters. ED resumes his game. PETE’s seen enough and wades in.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Ed, since you’re not working at the moment, could you please clean up a bit?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I am working.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Since you are in the flat all the time do you think you could clean up a bit?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: And if you play the answer machine, could you take down everyone’s messages, not just your own?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: It’s not that taxing is it? Writing something on a ‘post-it’ note?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Nope. PETE’s mobile rings as he leaves (ring tone: ‘LIVE FOREVE by Oasis). He puts on his jacket. On the back is a ‘post- reading - ‘I AM A PRICK’ SHAUN sees this and shakes his head wearily at ED.  11.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. It was pretty funny.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Seriously, will you do what he said?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I ain’t doing nothing for him.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Well, do it for me then.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (pauses game) I’m sorry Shaun.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: No, I’m sorry Shaun. SHAUN puzzles, before his expression turns to disgust.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh man that’s bad. You’re rotten. ED laughs. SHAUN does too, as he covers his nose and mout

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I’1l stop doing them when you stop laughing.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’m not laughing. I’m going. SHAUN leaves. The phone rings. The answer machine picks u

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Hi, you’re through to Peter and Shaun. Please leave a message after the - Beep. PUSH IN as the RED LIGHT flashes.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hello Shaun, it’s me. Look I’m going to be tied up a bit today, I've got twenty year ten essays to mark and I want to get them out of the way, so when you book the table, can you make it eight rather than seven? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You’re probably not there anyway. I’ll try you at work. so...okay. Bye, bye. Bye. Bye. CLOSER. The RED LIGHT flashes. The screen is filled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG. A FOOTBALL hits SHAUN in the head. He turns to see BORED KID grinning at him. He responds playfully.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh you’re dead! SHAUN boots the ball back. He walks past PETE in his car crosses the road. He heads for the newsagent passing a HOMELESS MAN in a green coat with a dog on a lead. He sta with an ARM OUTSTRETCHED. SHAUN gives him some change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN grabs a coke from the fridge and goes to the counte

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Nelson? There’s no-one there. SHAUN waits, idly scanning across t day's papers, their headlines partially concealed. ‘G.M. CROPS BLAMED FOR...’ ‘...UNIDENTIFIED MUTILATED...’ ‘,..SUPER-FLU...’ ‘...DOWNED SATELLITE CAUSES...’ SHAUN peers closer. As if by magic, the SHOPKEEPER appear

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Hello my friend. No beer today?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Bit early for me. A PALE SUITED MAN enters hurriedly, as we follow SHAUN ou

dialogues.speaker: PALE SUITED MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Do you have any Aspirin?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sold out.  13.

dialogues.speaker: COMMUTER
dialogues.text: What! ?

dialogues.speaker: STATION GUARD
dialogues.text: Body on the line. SHAUN stands amid LIVID COMMUTERS. A POLICE CAR blazes pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN is sat on a bus crowded with BLANK PASSENGERS; a PA GUY listens to his walkman, an OLD MAN slowly nods off. SHAUN looks out of the window. On the street, he sees a Y WOMAN faint. A number of PASSERS-BY rush to her aid. SHAUN’S VOICE (0.S.) Gather round everyone...

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: ...gather round. Now as well as Mr. Sloman being off sick, I’m afraid Ash is also a bit under the weather, so I’m taking charge today, as I’m the...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oldest.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: ...Senior staff member. We reveal a bunch of surly young SHOP ASSISTANTS chewing unison, in front of SHAUN. Among them, NOEL and DANNY.

dialogues.speaker: NOEL
dialogues.text: I’m feeling under the weather, can I have the day off? A ripple of laughter. SHAUN tries to find it funny.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No, Ash genuinely is ill. So we’re going to have to pull together today- A mobile phone interrupts.  14.

dialogues.speaker: NOEL
dialogues.text: Yeah? Hello mate.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Noel, could you-

dialogues.speaker: NOEL
dialogues.text: Two seconds. NOEL holds up his hand. SHAUN concedes weakly.

dialogues.speaker: NOEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah man. I was totally munted. Yeah I spoke to him. He’s only got an ‘enry. SHAUN is left twiddling his red biro.

dialogues.speaker: NOEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright man. Laters. (hangs up) Continue.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Thanks. As Mr. Sloman says, “there’s no ‘I’ in ‘team’ but there is an ‘I’ in ‘pie’...something about a team pie...I don’t know. That’s it- The ASSISTANTS are already off, ambling to their stations

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Danny can you uh... DANNY is already opening the front doors...

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Sarah, will you um... SARAH is already switching on a bank of TV SCREENS...

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Phone off please Noel. This isn’t a social gathering. SHAUN pockets his biro and tries to look officious.

dialogues.speaker: NOEL
dialogues.text: Alright. Keep your hair on grandad.  15.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m only twenty nine for chrissakes. How old are you? Twenty? Twenty two?

dialogues.speaker: NOEL
dialogues.text: Seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (thrown) Really?...Look Noel, I know you don’t want to be here forever. Neither do I. I got things I want to do with my life.

dialogues.speaker: NOEL
dialogues.text: When? NOEL points to SHAUN’s top pocket. His biro has leaked.

dialogues.speaker: NOEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’ve got red on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN is demonstrating a TV to a young couple.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: This one comes with a digital package. You got your lifestyle channels... FLIP. We see a clip of MOANING COUPLES on ‘Trisha’. +.-you got your entertainment channels... FLIP. We see a LAME GAME SHOW with contestants in funny costumes. An unseen commentator laughs uncontrollably. ...you got your news channels... FLIP. We see images of a CRASH SITE. People in WHITE SUIT

dialogues.speaker: GRAVE LOOKING SCIENTIST. A DISTRAUGHT VOX POP. A CONVOY O
dialogues.text: MILITARY TRUCKS, RED LIGHTS flash. SHAUN stops flipping.

dialogues.speaker: NOEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shaun!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’m with a customer.  16.

dialogues.speaker: NOEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s your Dad! SHAUN looks to the counter. With NOEL is a MIDDLE-AGED MA SHAUN apologises to his customers and goes over. PHILIP is a greying bear of a man. He wears DRIVING GLOVE and makes only cursory eye contact with SHAUN.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Philip.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Shaun. I trust you haven’t forgotten about tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Your bi-monthly visit.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I haven’t forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: You could bring the flowers you forgot to send Barbara on Mother’s Day.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was gonna.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: And not a cheap posy from a garage forecourt.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I wasn’t gonna.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: The Texaco.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Alright!

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Well, we'll look forward to seeing you tomorrow then. They glare at each other, before PHILIP heads for the doo SHAUN watches him leave, noticing another CONVOY OF MILIT TRUCKS on the street, RED LIGHTS flashing.  17.

dialogues.speaker: NOEL
dialogues.text: Thought this wasn’t a social gathering.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NOEL
dialogues.text: How come you’re allowed to talk to your Dad?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Look, A) he is not my Dad, he’s my stepdad and B) it was an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: NOEL
dialogues.text: What, buying your Mum some flowers?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: ...Yes. NOEL grins to some nearby ASSISTANTS who snigger.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look Noel, whatever you might think, I don’t find it difficult to keep my work and my social life separate. The phone rings. DANNY answers.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Shaun, Liz for you. SHAUN takes it, adopting a businesslike tone.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Allo, it’s me.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Allo.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Just quickly, d’you get my message? SHAUN sees that NOEL and the other ASSISTANTS are watchin

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yep.  18.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So it’s all okay then?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Eight instead of seven?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yep. SHAUN fakes a yawn and makes a ‘wrap it up’ signal.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay cool, well, ring me later.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Goodbye Liz.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Bye. SHAUN hangs up and turns to NOEL and the others.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Liz. Head office. Nothing to panic about.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. FLORIST -EVENING
dialogues.text: A DISTRESSED BUSINESSMAN, crying loudly, runs past the wi of a florist. Inside, SHAUN watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIST
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Sorry, yeah, they’re for my Mum. The FLORIST produces some tags.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIST
dialogues.text: ‘To a Wonderful Mum’ or ‘POW! Super Mum’.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Um...first one. SHAUN writes out the card and hands it back. He looks bac the street. On the other side of the road is a SCRUFFY MA the steps of a CHURCH, surrounded by pigeons.  19. SHAUN watches as the SCRUFFY MAN swipes at the pigeons. Amazingly he catches one. SHAUN’s transfixed as the SCRUFFY MAN raises the pigeon t his mouth. Surely he isn’t going to... A BUS pulls up outside. SHAUN cranes to see through the windows. When the bus pulls away, the SCRUFFY MAN is gone COMMUTER’S VOICE (0.S.) What the hell’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN is again amid a crowd of PISSED OFF COMMUTERS.

dialogues.speaker: STATION GUARD
dialogues.text: Bodies on the line. Suicides.

dialogues.speaker: COMMUTER
dialogues.text: Suicide?

dialogues.speaker: STATION GUARD
dialogues.text: Suicides. Three. The GUARD raises three fingers. SHAUN is a little freaked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN is again on a bus crowded with BLANK PASSENGERS. Th man next to SHAUN coughs badly. The lady in front seems t have nodded off and is dribbling. The bus is barely movin

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: SHAUN walks. Cars honk, a traffic jam clogging up the roa He looks ahead to the cause, a CAR has stalled at the lig A HAND slaps SHAUN on the arm.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Ohmigod, Shaun!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yvonne? YVONNE is in her late twenties. She’s jovial and short. S and SHAUN embrace, slightly awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: How you doing?  20.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Surviving.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Haven’t seen you since the days of... YVONNE mouths a house beat and does a little dance. SHAUN nods. A CROWD starts to gather around the stalled car.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yep, good times.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: You living round here?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Uh...yeah. You?

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’ve just bought a place.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Bought? MORE PEOPLE gather around the CAR.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Bit grown up eh? You still with...

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Liz. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: That’s great. She still teaching? An AMBULANCE pulls up. The SIREN forces them to shout.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Uh...yeah. She’s Head of English now. Got fast- tracked.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Ooh wow. What about you? Last time I saw you, you were working at that bloody electrical place.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah... YVONNE clocks his name-tag and realises her faux pas.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: You still deejaying?  21.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Not really. Kinda let it go, y'know? The SIREN wails on. YVONNE nods.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: That’s a shame. Well, least you and Liz are still together. Glad somebody made it. How long’s it been now?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Four years. Last week actually.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Aw, did you doing anything special?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No, we’re going for a meal tonight.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Ooh, anywhere nice? The SIREN slows. Realisation dawns. SHAUN goes ashen-face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRONT DOOR swung open...FLOWERS thrown into the sink...YE PAGES flung open. We see on the page: ‘Fulci’s. The place that does all the fish’. SHAUN anxiously paces on the phone. ED plays his videogam

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You gonna thank me then?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Tidying up.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Doesn’t look that tidy.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Well, I had a few beers when I finished. The phone picks up at the other end.  22.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fulci’s. Can you hold, please?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You want your messages?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What? ED produces a scrap of paper and reads aloud.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Your Mum phoned about you going round tomorrow. Liz phoned about you guys eating out tonight. Then your Mum phoned again to see if I wanted to eat her out tonight.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Look, I know it’s short notice, but do you have a table for two for tonight?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry, we just gave away the last table. CLICK. The line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Aw, man! A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: That wasn’t true about your Mum. SHAUN stares at the receiver, deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: So, what are we going to do then? Where are we going to go?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: The Winchester?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Don’t be so stupid! They don’t do food.  23.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: John’1l do you a toastie. There’s a Breville out the back.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed, this is serious! SHAUN slams the phone down, it rings. He picks up.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Aollo.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (caught out) ..-Allo...

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So what’s the plan then?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah, uh...babe, there’s been a bit of a problem with the table.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: They’re full up.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: But you said it was all okay.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You didn’t book it did you?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So what is the plan then? Silence. ED looks at SHAUN. He raises his eyebrows and no

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (tentatively) We could go to...The Winchester?  24. SHAUN winces. CLICK. The phone goes dead. The YELLOW PAGES hits the floor...The FLOWERS are grabbed The FRONT DOOR is swung wide...

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. TAXI CAB -EVENING
dialogues.text: ...A TAXI CAB DOOR slams shut. SHAUN sits anxiously in th back of the cab, feigning interest in the DRIVER’s waffle

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...so he starts reaching through the window and moaning at me and I can’t understand what’s he’s bloody goin’ on about, so I drives off. Bedlam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAB screeches off. SHAUN runs with the flowers across grass forecourt of an apartment block. He reaches the fro door and slams the intercom buzzer for LIZ’s flat.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Dianne. Let me in please.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: I’m not sure this is the best time Shaun.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh come on!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lizzy doesn’t want to see you, Shaun.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Just open the door!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She doesn’t want to see you. Furious, SHAUN looks up to the FIRST FLOOR WINDOW.  25.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do? Do you want me to climb up the drainpipe and come through the window? Because I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A worried DAVID and DIANNE stand by the entry phone, in t coats. Behind, LIZ emerges, also preparing to go out.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Alright then. There are noises from outside. All look to the OPEN WINDO BUZZ. The entry phone again.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Guys? Let me in. Please. INT. LIZ’S BATHROOM -MOMENTS LATER A furious LIZ busies herself, getting ready to go out. SHAUN flits around her.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Liz, I can explain. Let’s just go out.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What, to the Winchester?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Do you want to?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Hmm, let me see. Liz, let’s have a quiet one in the Winchester. Liz, it’s Saturday night. Winchester night. Hey Liz, there’s a quiz on this evening. Really? Aw, I love a good quiz. Well, do you want to come? Yeah, where’s it on? THE WINCHESTER! No, I don’t fucking want to!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Sorry, I just thought we could-  26.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: It’s not the only place in the world Shaun!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I know, we can go somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID and DAVID and DI sit on the sofa, listening through the wall.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m going out with David and Di.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, let’s all go together.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What, you hang out with a bunch of teachers? Sorry, a failed actress and a twat? DI look at each other, affronted.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s a bit harsh.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Your words.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I did not call Dianne a failed actress.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Cuh! DIANNE is relieved. DAVID remains affronted. LIZ storms i the lounge, with SHAUN in tow, helping her with her coat.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Seriously, let’s go out somewhere, forget all this. We’ll have a laugh, just the two of us. Things’1l be cool. Promise. LIZ turns angrily on SHAUN, who cowers behind the coat.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Oh stop making these promises!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  27.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Off the top of my head? You promised you'd stop smoking when I did. You promised you'd go back to the gym. You promised we’d go flat hunting. You promised you’d start deejaying again. You promised you'd try drinking red wine instead of beer. You promised you’d come on holiday with me. You-

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: We went to Greece didn’t we?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: We met in Greece.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (disdainfully) At a rave.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: It’s not the same. You promised things would change.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: You promised you'd get us free cable.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’m working on that!

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (to Liz) Well, look...I can stop smoking. I can give up whenever I want. See? SHAUN takes out a fag packet and chucks them in the bin.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What was the next one?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: It’s not enough, Shaun. LIZ walks out, leaving SHAUN with DAVID and DI.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Basically, I think your nine lives are up-  28.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh get fucked four-eyes! Why don’t you go out with her, you love her so much? DAVID goes red.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you mean by that. SHAUN makes a ‘like you don’t know’ face and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know what he means by that. DIANNE says nothing. INT. LIZ’S ROOM -CONTINUOUS LIZ is sat on her bed. Head in her hands. SHAUN enters.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Got you these. He offers her the flowers with a smile. LIZ clocks the ta

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: “To A Wonderful Mum”?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah...cos, remember last night, you said you didn’t want to sound like my Mum... LIZ laughs, more out of exasperation than amusment. A pau

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: They are for your Mum aren’t they?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Smooth. LIZ returns her head to her hands.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Sorry. I wasn’t thinking. I’m tired.  29.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: You're tired? It’s not the strongest defence is it? I’m tired Shaun.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: The ‘S’ word again.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Sor...

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: You can’t just keep saying ‘sorry’ and expect things to be okay. You wave it around like a ‘get out of jail free’ card.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: But, what if I am sorry?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What if you are? It’s not like you ever do anything about it. Nothing ever changes. (she sighs) Look, I’ve got to do something. If I don’t, I’m going to end up in that pub, every night for the rest of my life, like those other sad old fuckers, drinking myself to death, wondering what the hell happened.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What do you mean “do something”?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM. SHAUN is stood outside. Still in his work clothes. Still holding the flowers. Face like... THUNDER. Rain falls. SHAUN stares blankly ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN walks toward the pub, still holding the flowers. He sees a SNOGGING COUPLE in the shadows. He throws the flow into a NEARBY BIN.  30.

dialogues.speaker: ED'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shauny...

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...hog lumps! A packet of PORK SCRATCHINGS hits a glum SHAUN in the fac cheery ED joins him at their usual table. Behind, a wall mounted TV shows a SQUAD CAR whizzing thro suburbs, lights flashing. Seconds later, the pub is illuminated by the FLASHING LIGHTS of a passing squad car

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck her. You got your pint. You got your pig snacks. What more d’you want? Your favorite monkey don’t you? You want me to do Clyde? ED proceeds to ape Clyde the orangutan from ‘Every Which But Loose’. SHAUN looks at him, bereft.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See I knew you’d get over her.

dialogues.speaker: SINEAD O'CONNOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘It’s been 7 hours and 15 days...’ ‘Nothing Compares 2 U’ starts up on the JUKEBOX.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Who the hell put this on?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s on random.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Oh for fuck’s sake! John? ED motions to JOHN for another round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...CURTAINS ARE DRAWN...DEAD BOLTS click into place...The FRUIT MACHINE and JUKEBOX are switched off. SHAUN and ED now among the last customers and are utterly pissed. ED ignites two SAMBUCA shots. He and SHAUN ritualistically d them, spluttering and laughing.  31.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You know what we should do tomorrow? A hand appears on ED’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Keep it down a bit lads.

dialogues.speaker: ED/SHAUN
dialogues.text: Sorry John. JOHN moves off with their empties. ED continues quietly.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You know what we should do tomorrow? Keep drinking. Have a Bloody Mary first thing. Get a bite at The King’s Head. Grab a couple at The Little Princess, stagger back here and bang! We’re up at the bar for shots. How’s that for a slice of fried gold? SHAUN remains utterly glum. ED (CONT’D) C’mon man talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Can we just leave it Ed?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: A lot.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: She said if she stayed with me, she was going to end up sitting in here every night for the rest of her life like these sad old fuckers, drinking herself to death, wondering what the hell happened.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: That’s harsh. These are not sad old fuckers. These are rich, interesting characters.  32. Cut away to a number of SAD OLD FUCKERS around the bar.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Like who? ED points to a MULLET HAIRED FIFTYSOMETHING at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Snakehips. Always surrounded by women. Bigamist. Strangled his first wife with a draft excluder. Invented the mobile disco. Vaguely amused, SHAUN points to an IRISH SPINSTER necking whisky.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What about her?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Ex-porn star. Done it all. Mish, doggy, reverse cowgirl, A2M. Starred in the world’s first interracial hardcore loop. Cafe au lait.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What about John?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Who, the “Barrel”? North London Mafia. SHAUN laughs and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That really is true. Big Al says so.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Big Al also says dogs can’t look up.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Think about it. The gruff demeanor. Handy with a blade. Bernie, the trophy wife. ED points to BERNIE, the wizened landlady behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s connected. Why d’you think there’s a rifle over the bar?  33. ED nods to a rifle mounted on a brace.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: ‘Cos the pub’s called the Winchester.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Exactly. SHAUN lets himself laugh. ED smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See, you don’t need Liz to have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed! Let’s just leave it now.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Listen, can I just say one thing? And I’m not gonna say, ‘there’s plenty more fish in the sea’. I’m not gonna say, ‘if you love her let her go’...I’m not gonna bombard you with cliches. All I’1l say is, ‘it’s not the end of the world’. THUMP. THUMP. THUMP. A SHADOWY FIGURE is visible beyond t frosted glass of the door. JOHN calls out to it.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Sorry we're closed.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhh... More EMERGENCY VEHICLES pass. The flashing lights momenta define the FIGURE at the door. Maybe it’s a trick of the light, but it appears to have NO LOWER JAW. The FIGURE follows the noise and shuffles off.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Pisshead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON SIGN: “PLEASE LEAVE QUIETLY” SHAUN & ED drunkenly belt out ‘White Lines’. The SNOGGING COUPLE are still outside, necking furiously. ED calls ove

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Haven’t you had your tea?  34. The WOMAN stops necking the man. He goes limp and drops t the ground. She watches SHAUN & ED stagger off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN & ED cross the street, still singing ‘White Lines’ harmony. Behind, another FIGURE is stumbling down the mid of the road. He appears to join in with...

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhhh. SHAUN and ED turn, gleefully trying to draft their new fr into the sing-a-long. Again he responds with... THE FIGURE (CONT’D) Uhhhhhhh. SHAUN and ED shrug, a little disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘CRUCIAL ELECTRO’ blares. An old-skool party is in full swing; ED body pops. SHAUN is on his turntables.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Still got it! PETE storms in. He grabs the record off the turntable-

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Don’t scratch it! -and throws it through the open window.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s the second album I ever bought!

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: It’s four in the fucking morning!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s Saturday-

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: No, it’s fucking Sunday and I have to go into fucking work in four fucking hours, because every other fucker in my fucking department is fucking ill! Can you see why I’m so fucking angry?  35.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Pete, I’m sorry. We’re a bit pissed. We split up with Liz tonight.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Well just keep it down okay? PETE heads for the door. As he does, ED mutters-—

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Prick.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Sorry, what was that?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Nuffin. PETE launches at ED, fists flying. SHAUN pulls them apart

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Hey. Come on. We’re all friends here.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: He is not my friend! He’s an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: It means maybe you should fuck off. You wanna live like an animal, go live in the shed, you thick fuck.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Pete, leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Stop defending him! Why do you stick up for him all the time Shaun? All he does is hold you back. Or does it make life easier having someone around who’s more of a loser than you?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What’s that supposed to mean?  36.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. I presume it was Liz who did the dumping? Am I right? Sort-your-fucking-life-out- mate- SHAUN is utterly floored. ED interrupts-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What’s up with your hand man? We reveal that PETE’s hand is completely bandaged up.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I got mugged on the way home.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: By who?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I dunno, some crackheads or something. One of them bit me. (Ed breaks out laughing) It’s not fucking funny!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Why did they bite you?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I didn’t stop to ask them! Now, I have a splitting headache and your stupid hip hop isn’t helping. (storming out) And the front door’s open again!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: It’s not Hip Hop, it’s Electro. Prick. A shell-shocked SHAUN doesn’t reply. ED slumps on the sof

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Next time I see him he’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALL/KITCHEN -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: SHAUN shuffles out into the hall and plays the answer pho We hear Liz’s message from earlier- -as SHAUN stands in the darkened kitchen and stares at a photo of him and Liz, pinned to a ‘THINGS TO DO’ board.  37. As Liz and Barbara’s messages play, he scrawls something the board, then drunkenly slumps onto a kitchen chair.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KITCHEN -SUNDAY MORNING
dialogues.text: SHAUN wakes, groggy and hung-over. He’s still in the chai His eyes focus on the ‘THINGS TO DO’ board. It reads- ‘GO ROUND MUM’S...GET LIZ BACK...SORT LIFE OUT’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ED is still slumped on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Want anything from the shop?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Cornetto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN crosses the street. In the distance we glimpse TWO FIGURES shambling up the middle of the road.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Nelson? No-one is behind the counter. SHAUN grabs a Strawberry Cornetto from the freezer and goes to the cooler. He open the door, not noticing two smeared BLOODY HANDPRINTS ON T GLASS. SHAUN grabs a Coke oblivious, slipping as he moves off.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nelson? SHAUN goes to the counter. It seems oddly bare.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nelson, you got any papers? SHAUN shrugs and puts some change onto the counter.  38.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I owe you fifteen pence Nels. Alright? SHAUN leaves. In the security mirror we can see the body Nelson slumped at the back of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN crosses the street again. One of the FIGURES is clo now, its ARMS OUTSTRETCHED. It wears a GREEN COAT and tra a dog lead in its hand. SHAUN fishes in his pockets, with really looking over.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Sorry mate, no change. Shaun goes inside. In the distance, we can see the figure Nelson shamble out of the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN sits down and puts his feet up on the coffee table. cracks open his Coke and picks up the remote, flicking id through the Sunday morning television.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS
dialogues.text: ‘Religious groups are calling it Judgement Day. There's.. MIV: THE SMITHS ‘Panic on the streets of London...’ NEWS: ANOTHER REPORTER ‘...as an increasing number of...’ FOOTBALL SHOW: COMMENTATOR ‘...serious attacks on...’ NEWS: A DIFFERENT REPORTER AGAIN ‘...people, who are literally being...’ WILDLIFE SHOW: LIONS DEVOUR A GAZELLE ‘...eaten alive...’

dialogues.speaker: NEWS
dialogues.text: ‘Witness reports are sketchy but one unifying detail seem be that the attackers in many instances appear to be...’ KIDS SHOW: A TV PRESENTER ‘...dead excited to have with u here...’ SHAUN flips back to the previous channel, curious. NEWS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘,,..accounts of multiple unidentified assailants...’ SHA leans forward to watch more closely.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There’s a girl in the garden. SHAUN turns. ED is peering through the back window.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: In the garden, there’s a girl. SHAUN joins ED at the window. Standing at the very bottom the garden is a GIRL with her back to them.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GARDEN -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: SHAUN calls timidly to the GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Hello...excuse me. ED picks up a lump of mud and throws it at the GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Oi! The missile strikes her on the head. She turns slowly.

dialogues.speaker: WE SEE HER FACE
dialogues.text: She is pale, greyish. Her eyes are lifeless and cloudy. H hair is matted with something. Her CHECKOUT GIRL’S unifor dirty and torn. The image is horrific and unmistakable.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh my God! She is so drunk.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: How much have you had love? She lurches forward, her ARMS OUTSTRETCHED towards SHAUN. and SHAUN step back, giggling.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ooh she likes you.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Shut up.  40.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I think she wants a cuddle. She keeps coming. Mouth open. HISSING. SHAUN backs up.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Look I’ve just come out of a relationship- He trips and falls. THE GIRL is quickly on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ed, do something!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Wait there. ED runs back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed!

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Two seconds. SHAUN gets a clear look at her eyes. Something’s not righ

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold it there. ED has come running back with a FUN CAMERA. Takes a snap.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Get her off me. ED pushes the GIRL away. She stumbles, then comes back at them both. ED gets his first good look.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What’s up with your eyes? What’s up with her eyes? SHAUN jumps up and shouts to the GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Now seriously, I’m warning you... She keeps coming...SHAUN clocks her name badge.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Mary. I’m going to have to get physical. I mean it! She keeps coming. SHAUN loses his patience.  41.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right, this is it! Fuck off! SHAUN shoves MARY hard in the chest. She stumbles down th garden, falls backwards and IMPALES HERSELF onto the rust remnants of a free standing clothes line. The metal pole protrudes through her stomach. BLOOD oozes through her to SHAUN puts his hands to his mouth. ED bites his lip. SQUELCH. She gets up. SHAUN is momentarily relieved...bef seeing the GAPING HOLE IN HER STOMACH. ED starts to wind the fun camera. SHAUN bats it out of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think we should go back inside.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Okay. They turn to see a HULKING MAN right behind them. His eye dead also. He has massive injuries to his face and neck..

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOUNGE -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: ED stands by the window. The curtains are drawn.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Shaun? SHAUN’s on the phone, dialling fast.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Shit. It’s engaged.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What about an ambulance?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s busy Ed.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Fire engine?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed, it’s one number and it’s busy. Why do you want a fire engine anyway?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Anything with flashing lights man.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Are they still out there?  42. ED opens the curtains. MARY and THE HULK are still out th They look at ED. He promptly shuts the curtains again.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah...what do you think we should do?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Let’s have a sit down. They sit on the sofa. Upright, close to each other. They watch a TIRED AND TROUBLED NEWSREADER on the TV. Behind t through the hall, we see the FRONT DOOR move.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSREADER, (T.V.)
dialogues.text: -although it’s been hard to establish how this could have happened on such a wide scale and so rapidly- BEHIND THEM. The FRONT DOOR opens.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSREADER, (T.V.)
dialogues.text: -Environmental Health Officials have refused to confirm that the phenomenon is the result of a virus- We see live footage of SHAMBLING FIGURES in a street.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Do you think this is the same thing? BEHIND THEM. A SUITED MAN wanders in.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSREADER, (T.V.)
dialogues.text: -the Home Office are asking people to stay in their houses. Ensure your residences are secure with all windows and doors firmly locked- SHAUN and ED turn to each other, then look- BEHIND. THE SUITED MAN lumbers into the lounge. His shoul has been torn away. He looks pale and hungry.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN/ED NEWSREADER, (T.V.)
dialogues.text: Fuck! ...avoid contact with these individuals... SHAUN & ED jump off the sofa. The SUITED MAN lurches.  43.

dialogues.speaker: SUITED MAN NEWSREADER, (T.V.)
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhh... ...if you find your safety is compromised, it is important to remain calm... SHAUN and ED panic. They back around the room attempting evade the SUITED MAN, who pursues them relentlessly.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSREADER, (T.V.)
dialogues.text: -We're expecting information from the Home Office regarding the best way to...uh...neutralize the attackers, as they are seemingly impervious to conventional force- Suddenly ED grabs a heavy glass ashtray and brings it dow hard on the SUITED MAN’s head. CRACK! He falls back, lifeless, skull split open. SHAUN and ED stand panting.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’m just going to shut the front door. SHAUN runs out into the hall. ED goes over to the body.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSREADER, (T.V.)
dialogues.text: ..in the meantime contact with these assailants is highly inadvisable... SHAUN rejoins ED, who is staring at the body.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Did you see his head go? THUMP! THUMP! THUMP! MARY and THE HULK want in. ED (CONT’D) NEWSREADER We should get out there. -officials suggest that-

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN NEWSREADER
dialogues.text: No we should stay inside. -in extreme circumstances- ED (CONT’D) NEWSREADER Come on, we can take ‘em. -the attackers can be stopped-

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN NEWSREADER
dialogues.text: But the man said to stay (sips his water) indoors. -uh I repeat-

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck the man!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: As long as we’re in here and they’re out there, we’re safe. SMASH. The back window goes. MARY and THE HULK pull the curtains down and reach through the broken glass.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSREADER
dialogues.text: -removing the head or destroying the brain. SHAUN takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GARDEN -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: A WHISTLE. MARY and THE HULK stop thumping and turn to se and SHAUN standing determinedly next to a cardboard box.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Aim for the head. The boys hurl the contents of the box; a variety of kitch implements, saucepans etc. They bounce ineffectually off intruders. Within seconds the arsenal is spent.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Now what? MARY and THE HULK close in. ED looks to the nearby shed.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: We’ll have to get more stuff. What’s in the shed?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It’s locked.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Why is it locked?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s always been locked.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Well, what are we going to- ED spies the discarded ‘CRUCIAL ELECTRO’ album on the gra

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed, no- Too late. ED flings the record frisbee style. SMACK. It catches THE HULK in the face, throwing his head back.  45.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Bam! THE HULK staggers back up, the record sticking out of his face. A look of confusion between SHAUN and ED.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GARDEN -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: SHAUN unclips the lid on an expensive looking record box.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Now look, some of these are limited- ED grabs a record and flings it. It flies past MARY’s hea ED starts ED flings

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What was that one?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I think it was Blue Monday.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Aw, man! That was an original pressing.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Oh, for fuck’s sake. flicking through the records.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘Purple Rain’?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: ‘Sign Of The Times’?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Definitely not.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. The ‘Batman’ soundtrack?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Throw it. disappointing Prince. It lodges in MARY’s thigh.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Dire Straits?  ED flings 46.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Throw it. dreary A.O.R. It thuds into THE HULK’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Oootcha!! Okay, ‘Stone Roses’?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: ‘Second Coming’?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I like it! ED picks another record. MARY and THE HULK bear down. ED throws.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: ‘Sade’?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It's Liz’s.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: She did dump you! It misses and shatters against the house.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh fuck this. I’m going to the shed. SHAUN walks towards the shed. ED follows.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I thought you said it was locked.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS.
dialogues.text: The door splinters open. SHAUN crashes through. steps in after him. They survey the contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN and ED emerge from the shed. SHAUN carries a cricke bat, ED has a spade. MARY and THE HULK are right on top o them. There’s no other option.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Which one do you want? Girl or Bloke?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Um...first one. WHACK. The first blow is tentative and reluctant. Each st gains confidence and force. MARY and THE HULK go down. Th blows become frenzied and in perfect synch. MARY and the HULK are finally dead. SHAUN and ED stop, hyperventilating together. Their hands bloodied. Their clothes splattered. Their faces shocked. A baptism of gor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN and ED are back on the sofa. SHAUN has a mug of tea his shaking hand. ED eats his Cornetto and points to SHAU shirt.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You’ve got red on you. A FRAZZLED CORRESPONDENT talks over footage of a GREYISH clawing at the glass of an observation room.

dialogues.speaker: CORRESPONDENT, (T.V.)
dialogues.text: -scientists have now confirmed that in all cases, people receiving bites have experienced headaches and nausea and developed symptoms similar to those displayed by their attackers. If you know someone who has been bitten it is absolutely essential that you isolate them immediately- SHAUN and ED look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FRONT HALL -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: SHAUN and ED stands at the foot of stairs, looking up.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Pete? Pete?  48.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Why don’t we just go up?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’m not going up there.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Because A) he might be one of them and B) he might be really annoyed. Pete? Must have gone to work.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (finding Pete’s keys) How come he didn’t drive?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (reaching) Probably got a lift. He said he wasn’t feeling well. Pete?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (shouting) Oi, PRICK?! Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ED/SHAUN
dialogues.text: He’s not in. SHAUN thinks. ED gets out his fags and offers one to SHAU

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’ve given up.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Since- Just as SHAUN remembers, the phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Liz?  49.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shaun.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Mum! I was just going to call you actually. Is everything okay? ED’s ears prick up. He instinctively stubs out his fag.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Some men tried to get into the house.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Are they still there?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. We’ve shut the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Did you try the police?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: I thought about it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Did they hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, I’m fine, I’m fine...

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Mum?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, they were a bit bitey. The colour drains from SHAUN’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh my God Mum. Have you been bitten? The colour drains from ED’s face too.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, but Philip has.  50.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh okay.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Has she been bitten?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (covers mouthpiece) No, Philip has.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Oh okay.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What sort of state is he in Mum?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, he’s fine. A bit under the weather.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What’s the deal?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (covers mouthpiece) We may have to kill my stepdad. (back to Mum) Look Mum, you’re not safe there. Sit tight. We’re on our way over.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t want to cause a fuss.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: We’re coming to get you Barbara!

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOUNGE -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: SLAM. A boot hits the coffee table. ED laces. SHAUN paces

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: So what’s the plan? SHAUN takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Right... Cue MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take Pete’s car and we drive over to Mum’s.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We take care of Philip.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then we take Mum to Liz’s place and wait there until all this blows over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN and ED driving along in Pete’s car. They pull up at Barbara and Philip’s and run heroically inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN and ED stand armed, behind a ZOMBIE PHILIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anguished, SHAUN and ED whack PHILIP on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN, ED and BARBARA are greeted by a grateful LIZ on the doorstep. They sit inside, drinking tea and eating biscuits. Why do we have to go to Liz’s?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Because we do.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: But she dumped you!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I have to make sure she’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Because I love her! SHAUN surprises himself. A pause. Alright gay. I’m not staying there

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: though.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: If we hole up, I wanna be somewhere familiar. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wanna know where the exits are and I wanna be allowed to smoke.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Okay... Cue MONTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Take Pete’s car. Get Mum.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Deal with Philip.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Go to Liz's, pick her up and then come back here and wait for it all to blow over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN and ED pull up at Barbara and Philip’s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand behind ZOMBIE PHILIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Less anguished, they whack PHILIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN, ED and BARBARA arrive at Liz’s. SHAUN carries LIZ to the car. They pull up at the HOUSE. They sit drinking tea and eating biscuits. Wait. We can’t bring them here.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s not exactly safe,

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: is it? Yeah. And look at the state of it. There’s a corpse in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Where’s safe? Where’s familiar?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Where can I smoke? SHAUN and ED look at each other.  53. Cue MONTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Get Mum. SHAUN and ED screech up.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do Philip. SHAUN and ED are in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sorry. Whack!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Get Liz, then wait for all SHAUN carries LIZ out. They this to blow over, in the pull up at THE WINCHESTER and only truly sensible and safe are ushered in by JOHN and place there is... the DORIS. They sit, drinking and Winchester. eating bar snacks.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: How’s that for a fried gold sandwich? The TV is still on in the background.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSREADER, (T.V.)
dialogues.text: ..To recap, it is vital that you stay in your homes; make no attempt to reach loved ones and avoid all physical contact with the assailants.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You believe everything you hear on

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: SHAUN flicks the TV off.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FRONT DOOR -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: A curtain is pulled back. We see Pete’s RENAULT MEGANE.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I see it man. It’s right outside. SHAUN’s at the front door. ED is psyching up. They both h their respective weapons; a spade and a cricket bat.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What’s the zombie situation?  54.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Don’t say that.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: That.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: The ‘Z’ word.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Because it’s ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Okay...are there any out there though? SHAUN looks out. The street seems empty.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No. Maybe it’s not as bad as all that. (looks the other way) Oh no, there they are. SHAUN points. We REFRAME a fraction to see LOTS OF ZOMBIE

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right, let’s do it. (beat) I’ve just go to do a wee first. SHAUN skips to the loo. ED calls after.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Can I drive?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I always wanted to drive Pete’s car. I might not get another chance. SHAUN shrugs and throws ED the keys.  55.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BATHROOM -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: A ZIP is unfastened...a TOILET FLUSHED...HAND washed. SHAUN stares at his reflection in the open door of the bathroom cabinet. He shuts it. In the reflection behind h NOTHING. He turns to see- PETE. Standing naked in the shower, his face is contorted with pain. His blank, milky eyes fix on a shocked SHAUN.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Pete, hi... ZOMBIE PETE reaches out, his hand black and gangrenous.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen man, we’re just going to borrow your car...but we’ll bring it back... Terrified, SHAUN backs out. ZOMBIE PETE slowly follows.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...if you feel better later...we’re going to the pub. You’re more than welcome to...join us.

dialogues.speaker: ZOMBIE PETE
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhh... SHAUN slams the bathroom door and runs off downstairs. AN ON THE HANDLE. It turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shocked SHAUN rejoins ED, who’s jangling the car keys.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Pete’d be so pissed off if he knew I was driving his car. Wouldn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FRONT GARDEN -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: SHAUN walks briskly to the CAR. ED tags behind.  56.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Shaun! Which button’s central locking? BANG. A FOOTBALL hits SHAUN on the head. He turns to see BORED KID. Now DEAD. Standing on the pavement nearby. ED panics and presses any button. The MEGANE’s alarm goes of

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cock it! The nearby ZOMBIES turn slowly. The DEAD KID approaches.. ED pushes another button, the alarm stops and the locks f up. SHAUN and ED dive into the car. ED turns the key- ...The lights come on...The DEAD KID paws the bonnet... ...The wipers activate...The ZOMBIES lurch closer... The indicators flash...... A ZOMBIE NELSON approaches, hand outstretched...The engine roars to life...The FRONT DOOR bursts open. A naked PETE staggers out of the house...

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ED drives fast through suburban streets. The radio is on. RADIO NEWSREADER The Church of England has now joined extremist groups in proclaiming the crisis as- SHAUN looks out of the window to see...a FATHER bundling crying kids into a family car...an ABANDONED AMBULANCE wi squirming bodybag on a gurney...ZOMBIES dotted around the street and parks. RADIO NEWSREADER (CONT’D) -evidence of a coming apocalypse. Once again bodies of the recently dead-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Can we put something else on? ED whips out a cassette and puts it in the player. HARD H booms. He grins at SHAUN- WALLOP! Something flies off the bonnet, up over the car a bounces across the road behind, ED slams on the brakes.  57.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We hit something.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Or someone. ED leans on the horn, making them both jump.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROAD -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: ED backs the car up level with the CRUMPLED BODY. SHAUN w down the window and calls over.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s just go.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: They’1l be dead either way.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: That’s not the point Ed- A CRACKING SOUND. They turn to see the broken body liftin its head, revealing...a GRIZZLED ZOMBIE. It hisses.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh thank God for that. The irony of this hits SHAUN as ED hits the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN and ED pull up outside Barbara and Philip’s. The on other car in the street is a gleaming JAGUAR XJ6 sitting the driveway. ED whistles.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You didn’t tell me Barbara had a Jag. Always wanted to drive one of those.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s Philip’s and he won’t let anyone near it. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I left half a Mars Bar in the glove box once, he chased me round the garden with a piece of wood.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Fuck. It’s gorgeous. SHAUN looks around. The street is strangely quiet.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Come on, it seems clear enough.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Why don’t I stay here?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Someone should stay with the car. Keep watch. If there’s any problems, I’1l honk three times.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Okay. Uncertain, SHAUN runs up the path. ED calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Don’t forget to kill Philip. INT. BARBARA & PHILIP’S HALL -MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Hello pickle.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Hey Mum.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: You’ve got red on you. BARBARA gets a tissue from her sleeve, licks it and dabs cheek clean. SHAUN looks warily into the house.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Yes, I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Where’s Philip?  59.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Dad's in the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: He’s not my Dad.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Oh Shaun, really.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Sorry Mum. Listen, Ed’s outside, we're getting you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: But we’ve got to wait for the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I don’t know if the doctor’s coming.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Well, I’m not sure Philip’s going to want to leave the house darling.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Philip’s not...why don’t you pop the kettle on? I’1l take care of Philip.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Okay. Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: I’1l make some sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: No fighting you two. INT. BARBARA & PHILIP’S LOUNGE -CONTINUOUS The door creaks open. A grey looking PHILIP is sat in an armchair. He is inert, wrapped in a blanket and facing th television, which plays RELIGIOUS PROGRAMMING. His eyes a closed. SHAUN approaches him, mind racing. He raises the CRICKET BAT above his head, as organ music on the TV swel  60.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry Philip.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Why? SHAUN yelps, hiding the BAT behind him.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What have you done now?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Nuffin.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: What’ve you got there? Flowers I hope.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No, it’s a...cricket bat.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Oh. SHAUN yelps again as BARBARA appears and takes the bat. BARBARA (CONT’D) Is that for the jumble Shaun?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: There’s a whole box of your toys upstairs, I was going to give them to the jumble.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: I took them all to the tip, Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh, what?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Shaun’s come to take us somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Don’t be silly, I’m not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Well maybe you should stay here and wait for the doctor. I’1l take Mum.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: You said the doctor wasn’t coming.  61.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: You didn’t call the doctor did you?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: I just thought it was best to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: I’m quite alright, Barbara. I’ve run it under a cold tap. And we had our jabs when we went to the Isle of Wight.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: But Philip-

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: It’s all a lot of overblown nonsense. Just a bunch of drugnuts running wild.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Still, should get Mum away, in case they come back.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere without Philip.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Mum...listen, did you make that tea?

dialogues.speaker: INT. KITCHEN -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: BARBARA makes tea. SHAUN is agitated.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Mum?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Mmmm?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: How much do you love Philip?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Two sugars is it?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I haven't had sugar in my tea since 1982.  62.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Will you cut me some bread love? SHAUN cuts bread with a fearsome looking bread knife.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Mum, how much do you love Philip?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Oh for goodness sake Shaun, must we go through this again?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry but...what would you think if I told you that he has, over the years, been quite unkind to me.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: You weren't always the easiest person to live with.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Mum, he chased me with a piece of wood.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Well, you did call him a ‘you know what’.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Did he tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Yes he did.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Shaun!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Sorry Mother...Mum. Did you know that, on several occasions, he touched me? BARBARA flashes SHAUN a look.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, that’s not true. Look, Mum you don’t understand- BARBARA stops what she’s doing. Turns to SHAUN.  63.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
