dialogues.text: No you don’t understand, Philip is my husband and has been for seventeen years. I know you haven’t always seen eye to eye but I would at least expect you to respect my feelings. You have to be more adult about these things.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes come on Shaun... PHILIP is stood at the kitchen door, his arm in a sling. looks weak but still towers over SHAUN.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...there comes a time when you’ve just got to be a man. SHAUN glances down at the knife in his hand, then back at PHILIP. His grip around the handle tightens. EXT. BARBARA & PHILIP’S HOUSE -MOMENTS LATER SHAUN drags his cricket bat like a stroppy teenager as he leads BARBARA and PHILIP up the path. There are still no ZOMBIES around.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Told you this was a fuss over nothing. ED stands at the end of the garden, hands in his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Hello Edward. My you’ve grown!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Better believe it. ED nods to PHILIP then whispers to SHAUN. ED (CONT’D) What happened? Why’s he coming?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It wasn’t as easy as all that. ED tuts at SHAUN. PHILIP stands by the JAG.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: So, we're following you are we?  64.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I think it’s best if we go in the- (looks to ED) Where’s the car? ED looks sheepishly off. We follow his gaze to see the RENAULT MEGANE wrapped around a lamppost. A write-off.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I pranged it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: You were parked.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah...guess we’ll have to take the Jag. SHAUN takes a deep breath and turns to PHILIP.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Umm. ..Philip?

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: What? A ZOMBIE appears right behind PHILIP. We recognise him as of the DAZED YOUNG CLUBBERS from earlier.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Look out! Too late. The ZOMBIE grabs PHILIP and takes a huge bite o of his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIST
dialogues.text: SHAUN sprints over and kicks the ZOMBIE clear. PHILIP fal Another CLUBBER ZOMBIE approaches, complete with whistle.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Philip, give me the car keys!

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: You're not driving that car.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Phillip... SHAUN spins and deftly smashes the 2nd ZOMBIE in the face knocking the whistle down his throat.  65.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...give me the car keys! PHILIP gives them to SHAUN, who throws them to ED.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ed! Get Mum in the car.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I’m on it! ED catches the keys and looks at them. He smiles for a mo before ushering BARBARA in. SHAUN pulls PHILIP off the ground, his neck gushes blood.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about me. Worry about your mother. SLAM! SHAUN jumps in the back with PHILIP. BARBARA’s up f with ED, who’s admiring the Jag’s interior.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Maybe I should drive.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I’ve adjusted the seat now.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Go on then. Just be caref- He’s drowned out by ED’s HARD HOUSE tape. They scream off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: London whizzes by. We catch whispers of ACCIDENTS, a CAR driving erratically with a BABY CARRIAGE on the roof. We ZOMBIES beating down the doors of houses. A huddle of ZOM KIDS are gathered around a body next to an ABANDONED ICE CREAM VAN. SHAUN attempts to bandage the profusely bleeding PHILIP w his jacket. The HARD HOUSE blares from the stereo.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Can we please turn that noise down?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: (offering a handful of tissues) Are you alright dear, would you like a tissue?  66.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: I'd be fine, if it wasn’t for that bloody racket.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: It is a little loud. ED turns it down immediately for her.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Sorry Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: You do realise this is a thirty mile an hour zone?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. ED winks at BARBARA and speeds recklessly onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JAG screeches to a halt. Everyone is thrown forward. now heavily bandaged PHILIP moans in pain.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Here. The forecourt is dotted with a FEW ZOMBIES, who lurch ove

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Mum, this won’t take a second. SHAUN tries the door, it won’t open. He turns to PHILIP.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you still got the child locks on?

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Safety first Shaun. SHAUN winds down the window and squirms out.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed, stay moving. Any problems-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Do the honks. ED cruises off around the forecourt. SHAUN heads for the door. Three ZOMBIES block his path. He knocks them down.  67. BUZZ. SHAUN slams the bell. Behind him the floored ZOMBIE quietly pick themselves up and advance again.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello? Before SHAUN can answer- HONK! HONK! HONK! ED beeps from Jag. SHAUN turns. The ZOMBIES are right on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A worried DAVID and DIANNE huddle round the entry phone, which buzzes with sounds of PITCH BATTLE. LIZ emerges fro her room and joins them. There is a noise at the window- It’s SHAUN. At the glass.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Guys? Let me in, please.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I've come to get you.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: You're bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s okay, it’s not mine. LIZ opens the window. SHAUN tumbles in, bat in hand. LIZ looks at him, half way between angry and impressed.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Sorry, what are you doing? SHAUN stands and catches his breath.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’ve come to take you somewhere safe.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What do you mean safe? We were perfectly safe until you turned up.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: You don’t know that.  68.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: But there were only two of them outside a minute ago and now how many are there?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Lots.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Lots.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Believe me, it only takes one of them to know you’re in here. Liz, I tried calling but I couldn’t get through. I had to come up with a plan.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Oh, you made a plan?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I don’t care what the telly says, we have to get out of here. If we stay, they will break down the door, they will come up here and they will tear us to pieces and that’s really going to exacerbate matters for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Smooth.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Listen to me. Please. You have to trust me. I’ve been out there, I’ve seen what’s happening. They’re not just going to give up and go away. They’11 keep coming.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun-

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: This isn’t about you and me Liz. It’s about survival. We need to be somewhere more secure, somewhere on the ground. Somewhere we can survive. LIZ'’s reluctance seems to waver.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We’re with you, Shaun.  69.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN LIZ
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: We're with you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m not going out there.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: You saw Titus at the National, Daffs. I don’t want to be torn to pieces and I’m sure, if you really think about it, neither do you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m not going if Lizzy isn’t going.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Of course she’s going.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m not staying here on my own.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: You’re going aren’t you Elizabeth?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Lizzy?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Liz? All eyes are on an uncertain LIZ. From outside, we hear a building chorus of moans. LIZ takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Alright Flash, what did you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Right...uh, I’ve got a car outside, but it’s going to be a bit cramped. So, have either of you got transport?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: (putting up her hand) Yes, yes.  70.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Good. Where?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Oh, no. I mean I’ve passed my test.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: David?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don’t think there’s any point owning a car in London.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Okay then, let’s just gather any blunt objects. If you get cornered, bash them in the head, that seems to work. Just keep together, stay sharp and follow me.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: So what is the plan then? SHAUN flips up his cricket bat and gathers himself.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (firmly) We’re going to The Winchester. CLOSE on the incredulous faces of LIZ, DI and DAVID. EXT. LIZ’S FLAT -MOMENTS LATER CLOSE on the terrified faces of LIZ, DI and DAVID; as the clumsily battle the ZOMBIES on their doorstep. LIZ wields hockey stick, DAVID an umbrella, DIANNE a piece of driftw SHAUN guides them through the crowd with his cricket bat.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Where’s the car? HONK! The Jag pulls up, knocking a ROADSWEEPER ZOMBIE flying...

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Whassup niggaz? Everyone stops momentarily and looks at ED, before breaki into a run for the Jag. LIZ squeezes into the front. SHAU DAVID and DI pile in the back. SHAUN is jammed next to PHILIP, who looks even worse. ZOMBIES encroach on the car  71.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Apologies for the cramped conditions. (to Di) Di, you sit on Dave’s lap if you can. (to Phillip) Phillip, hang in there. (to Ed) Ed, fast as you can okay? (to Barbara) And Mum this is Liz. (to Liz) Liz, Mum.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Hello. ED hits the gas. The engine roars.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. CAR -AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: The Jag is unbearably cramped. ED drives fast, flying ove speed bumps. The HARD HOUSE is back on the stereo. PHILIP moans weakly.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Shaun...

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Be careful will you Ed?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Is your Dad alright?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: He’s not my Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: He’s bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I know. Ed, will you please be careful?!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Thought you wanted to get there fast.  72. ED swerves slightly. A ZOMBIE glances off the bonnet.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oof!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I want to get there in one piece. And why are we going this way?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Chill out, it’s a short cut.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: But the other road goes straight to The Winchester.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Shaun... SHAUN ejects the tape with a huff.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I still don’t actually understand why we are going to The Winchester. SHAUN looks at LIZ. They keep eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s a pub, it’s safe, it’s secure-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: They know us there.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What makes it so secure?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (floundering) It’s got heavy doors. It’s got dead bolts. You’ve been to a lock in.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Several.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: And there’s a rifle above the bar.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I would think that’s deactivated.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Surely.  73.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: It’s not. I’m telling you, John’s connected. Big Al says so.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Big Al also says dogs can’t look up.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: They can’t.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Can’t they?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: No, they can’t.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Of course they can-

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Look, the pub’s the right place to go. Everything’s gonna be fine. Promise. Hearing the ‘P’ word, LIZ, DAVID and DI frown at SHAUN.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Shaun...

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I turned it off, alright?

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: It’s not easy.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What? PHILIP is fading, he tugs on SHAUN’s arm and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Being a father Shaun. It’s not easy. SHAUN is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What?  74.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: You were twelve when I met you, you’d already grown up so much.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah...well, I wasn’t the easiest person to live with.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: I just wanted you to be strong, not give up because you lost your Dad.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Philip, you don’t have to explain...

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: I do. I’ve always loved you Shaun, always thought you had it in you to do well. You just need motivation. Somebody to prove yourself to. I thought that could be me. SHAUN nods, eyes wide. With huge effort, PHILIP puts his on SHAUN’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take care of your Mum, there’s a good boy. PHILIP slips away. SHAUN closes his dead step-dad’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (tremulously) Ed, could you pull over?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Two seconds. ED swerves again. Another ZOMBIE bounces off the Jag.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sweet chin music!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed! Will you just pull over, please.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ED slams on the brakes. Everyone is thrown violently arou the interior as the car turns 180 and screams to a stop. passengers sit in shocked silence. ED whoops.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Christ! What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Chill out. Everyone’s alright. Furious, SHAUN punches the back of ED’s headrest.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Stop-telling-me-to-chill-out! ED huffs in sulky protest. SHAUN gathers himself.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And no, everyone is not alright.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Uh, well...Mum?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: What’s wrong Pickle?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Mum, it’s Philip...he’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Where’s he gone?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Mum, he’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: No he’s not. SHAUN looks at PHILIP who stares back milky eyed, UNDEAD.

dialogues.speaker: ZOMBIE PHILIP
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhh... Shit. A scramble for the doors. ZOMBIE PHILIP claws hungr at SHAUN. BARBARA, LIZ and ED pile out; ED accidentally k the HARD HOUSE tape back into the stereo. It BLARES again DAVID and DI struggle to get out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It won’t open!  76.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: It won’t open!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed, the child locks! ED slopes towards the door, but LIZ quickly steps in befo him to open it. DAVID and DI fall out, followed by SHAUN. turns to see PHILIP lunge at him. SHAUN slams the car doo

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Safety first Philip. SHAUN swings round and glowers at ED. He glowers right ba

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Now what? The GANG are out in the open. The HARD HOUSE draws the attention of several nearby ZOMBIES, who begin to close i

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: We have to keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: But how do we get Philip out of the car?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: We haven’t got time.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What about the blunt objects?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Do you want to get them? ED nods to the slavering PHILIP. BARBARA looks on in shoc

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Shaun, we can’t just leave your Dad.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: He’s not my Dad!

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Oh Shaun- SHAUN grabs a shaken BARBARA by the shoulders. BEHIND we ZOMBIE PHILIP lunging forward into the front seat.  77.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: He’s not Mum. He was but he’s not anymore-

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: I’m sure if we just-

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: That’s not even your husband. I know it looks like him but believe me, there is nothing of the man you loved in that car now. Nothing. BEHIND we see ZOMBIE PHILIP reach forward and SWITCH THE HOUSE OFF. He sits back and looks almost peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go shall we?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You're not seriously suggesting we walk are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN walks briskly along a high-fenced back alley.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Everyone okay back there?

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, we’re having a whale of a time. We see the GANG tagging along behind him; LIZ, DAVID and followed by a dazed BARBARA. ED skulks at the back, smoki

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Maybe we should all hold hands, y'know? Make a crocodile?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea where you’re going?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: David!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Sorry Lizzy.  78.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: (whispering to Shaun) Do you though?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Totally, totally.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: But are we close? SHAUN peers through fence slats into a nearby garden. The MULLET HAIRED FIFTYSOMETHING from the pub lies dead on th grass surrounded by a ravenous huddle of FEMALE ZOMBIES.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Pretty close. LIZ looks back to the glazed BARBARA, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Is your Mum going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I hope so. Did you manage to contact your folks?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: They’re in Antigua.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: D’you think it’s happening there?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Look Liz...about last night. I know a lot of things were said, but I just wanted you to know that-

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun, you said this wasn’t about you and me.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s not. I just wanted-

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: You said it was about survival.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It is-  79.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: You're not doing all this just to prove something are you?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No-

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Because, I meant everything I said last night. Nothing’s changed- A SCREAM in the distance is answered by a chorus of dista and not so distant moans which seem to surround them.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe this isn’t the best time to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I know, I know, I just- BANG. SHAUN walks right into-

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Ohmigod, Shaun!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yvonne? YVONNE is heading in the opposite direction with an uncan similar bunch of FRIENDS and FAMILY.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Uh...surviving.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Hey Liz. Long time no see.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Hey Yvonne. Haven’t seen you since... YVONNE replies with her dance again, then turns to her pa

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Sorry, this is my boyfriend Declan. That’s my Dad, my friends Mark and Maggie, my cousin Tom. Everyone mumbles a respective ‘hello’.  80.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is Shaun and his girlfriend Liz-

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They’ve broken up.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Oh really...?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Yeah... SHAUN looks at the ground. YVONNE looks awkward.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: That’s a shame...Well we should skoot. Have you got somewhere you're going?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're heading to the Winchester.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: The pub?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Right, well. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: You too. YVONNE and SHAUN hug. This time it’s real and affectionat The two groups move their separate ways. There is a weird poignancy to this passing...before YVONNE calls out.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Shaun? YVONNE points in a completely different direction.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Isn't the Winchester that way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH. A gate is kicked open.  81.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What’d I tell you? Pub’s just over there. We see the WINCHESTER’s sign in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: ‘Just over there’? What about the twenty garden fences? We CRANE DOWN to reveal a line of back gardens. SHAUN ste forward and peers into the next garden.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What’s the matter David, never taken a short cut? SHAUN attempts to vault the fence in a super cool fashion However it breaks under his weight, an entire section of fence FALLING FLAT. SHAUN quickly gets up and beckons the others to follow. BARBARA dawdles behind in a dazed fashi

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: I’m sure Jill and Derek live round here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GANG move commando style, from garden to garden.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Of course, in reality, we are trespassing. Am I right, Lizzy? LIZ doesn’t answer. She is distracted by evidence of othe lives affected by the crisis...a dog sitting next to a DE BODY...the twitching silhouette of a HANGED MAN...a ZOMBI PYJAMAS clawing at PATIO DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach a family garden, complete with outdoor games.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Right...Everyone just stay where they...hang on, are we all here? DI does a quick head count.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: One, two, three, four, five. Yes.  82.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: There’s six of us. A YELP from next door.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mum! SHAUN jumps onto a TRAMPETTE and vaults the fence with lightning speed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and lands to find BARBARA sprawled on the grass. He he her to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Mum, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: I don’t think Jill & Derek do live here. SHAUN looks to the house. The PATIO DOOR is now open...

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun, are you okay? CRASH. SHAUN tumbles through the fence, struggling with t PYJAMA ZOMBIE.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oi! LIZ and DIANNE leap into action. DAVID panics. ED slopes around for a weapon, but LIZ is already brandishing a KID CHAIR. ED shrugs and backs off.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Break it up! LIZ whacks the PYJAMA ZOMBIE, breaking the chair over its head. SHAUN gets to his feet and turns to see DAVID stand around and ED texting someone. SHAUN can’t believe it.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Shaun! DIANNE pulls a SWINGBALL out of the ground and throws it SHAUN. He looks at it, unsure what to do.  83. LIZ demonstrates a stabbing move. SHAUN flips up the shar end of the SWINGBALL pole and drives it through the PYJAM ZOMBIE’s chest, pinning him to a tree. Breathless, he spi round to DAVID and ED.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Feel free to step in anytime!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You seem to be doing alright.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I didn’t want to cramp your style. Incredulous, SHAUN shakes his head. He walks over to a child’s slide, by the fence.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Right-

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: So sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: -Everyone just stay where they are. I’ll check if the coast is clear. SHAUN climbs up...then climbs down.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Is it clear?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Lots. We CRANE UP over the fence to reveal a HUNDRED WALKING DE between them and the pub. The GANG peer through the gaps.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh well, that’s just great.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: There are a fair few of them. SHAUN stands a little way off, looking despondent.  84.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I trust Shaun has another genius scheme up his sleeve?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: This is hardly constructive David!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No Lizzy, this is a waste of time. We should have stayed at the flat.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Because-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Because what?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Because of...Captain Wow!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Will you stop it!

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: We’re not going to get anywhere by moaning.

dialogues.speaker: PYJAMA ZOMBIE, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhh... All turn to the PYJAMA ZOMBIE. It’s ‘alive’, but stuck on SWINGBALL pole, the ball too big for the hole made by the shaft. It MOANS, frustrated. DIANNE has an idea.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FINAL GARDEN -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: The GANG stand studying the captive PYJAMA ZOMBIE.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Right, shake out. Get nice and limber. Have another look at the way he moves. Remember it’s very limp. Almost like sleepwalking. And look at the face, vacant with a hint of sadness. Like a drunk who's lost a bet. And the voice, it’s a glottal rumble with a neutral ‘A’. Okay everyone, let’s have a look shall we?  85. They all do their zombie impressions. LIZ gives good moan

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice, good vocal work Liz. BARBARA is glazed over.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Barbara, that’s excellent.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry dear, I was miles away.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Daffs? DIANNE moves on. DAVID gives a lacklustre performance.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh come on.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I feel silly.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Just try to make yourself very loose. DAVID tries again. It’s exactly the same.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s mournful, sorrowful, you’re dead and you hate it. DAVID tries again. It’s still the same.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Better. Ed?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I’1l do it on the night.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: This is the night. ED makes a sarcastic ZOMBIE noise. SHAUN tuts.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What about yours?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What?  86.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Well, who died and made you king of the zombies? SHAUN flashes him an admonishing look, then proceeds to d pretty good ZOMBIE impression. ED has to concede.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Okay, now let’s try it altogether...1, 2, 3-

dialogues.speaker: THE GANG
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhh... All doing their ZOMBIE impersonations, the GANG slowly mo towards the pub. They are surrounded by legions of genuin ZOMBIES, who seem to be falling for it, despite only SHAU LIZ and DIANNE putting in any effort. DAVID is stiff with fear, ED isn’t trying and BARBARA is just glazed. They reach the pub door and surreptitiously bang on it. I locked. The GANG speak in whispers between their fake moa

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Get round me. The GANG surround SHAUN. He kneels at the letter box.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: John, Bernie, are you there? (louder ) John! John! Bernie! Some of the nearby ZOMBIES are faintly suspicious. SHAUN (CONT’D) DAVID It’s Shaun and Ed. We come in It’s not working. all the time. SHAUN (CONT’D) DAVID We do the quiz. They can hear you! SHAUN (CONT’D) DAVID Y'know, Q.W.A. Quizzers With They know! Attitude

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Stay in character Daffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can’t see them. More ZOMBIES cotton on to the GANG’s noise. LIZ looks BARBARA who is now rifling around in her handbag.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Is everything okay Barbara?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: I’m sure I had some more tissues in here.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun, we have to get inside.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Break the window.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Don’t be so stupid. We’1ll be totally exposed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We are totally exposed. Break the window.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Is there another way in Shaun?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: There's a-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Two seconds... (into the phone) Hey E-ball. Can’t talk now. No, I ain’t got nuffin. No, I’m right in the middle of something. Yeah, weird innit?-

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What am I doing? What are you doing you stupid moron? 87. over to A HALLOWEEN RING TONE. SHAUN glares furiously at ED, almo daring him to answer it. He does, holding up a hand. SHAUN SMACKS THE MOBILE FROM ED’S HAND. It skitters away.  88.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No, you fuck off. Fuck-fucking-off! SHAUN smacks ED hard with each successive ‘fuck’.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun-

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’ve spent a lifetime sticking my neck out for you, you idiot and all you ever do is fuck things up. Fuck things up and make me look stupid. Well, I’m not going to let you do it. Not today. ED is for once, speechless. LIZ taps SHAUN on the shoulde

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun... SHAUN turns to see EVERY SINGLE ZOMBIE LOOKING AT THEM.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were saying about another way in?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Uh...yeah, there’s a- CLATTER. DAVID has tipped over the NEARBY BIN, spilling t contents across the floor. He lifts it above his head.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT YOU DOING
dialogues.text: He launches the bin at the pub window. SMASHES IT WIDE OP

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Get inside!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No. They’11 follow us!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: They’11 follow us. Keep up the act. I’m going to have to do something.  89.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What do you mean, “do something”? SHAUN makes a big decision. He runs over to a picnic tabl

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oiiiiiiiiiiiiii! EVERY SINGLE ZOMBIE turns their attention to SHAUN.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait ‘til I’ve gone, then get inside.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ ED
dialogues.text: Gone where? Gone where?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (looks directly at Ed) I won't be gone long. (to LIZ) Promise. SHAUN looks at ED who looks back, concerned. A moment of silent understanding. SHAUN jumps down right into the thi of the approaching hordes and sprints off, yelling and wa his arms, drawing all the ZOMBIES away. He disappears out sight. The GANG are all shocked by this, particularly ED.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shall we go in then? As the GANG move toward the pub, BARBARA picks up the bun of flowers from the strewn rubbish and looks at the card.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Come on Barbara. Leave them.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: But they’re for me. As LIZ helps BARBARA through the window, a single ZOMBIE, DEAD IRISH SPINSTER turns to see them disappear inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS 360 round the pub lounge. It’s deserted, lit by fading shafts of daylight. The curtains have been draw over the broken window and billow ominously. We find LIZ DIANNE sitting silently with BARBARA staring at the openi ED stands forlornly by the fruit machine. DAVID paces.  90.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Will Shaun be gone long?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: No Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’s a good twenty minutes since he went.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Either way we should think about blocking up the window. We’re totally exposed.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: How will Shaun get back in?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m sure he’1l knock. Nobody moves. We can hear DISTANT MOANS outside.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh for goodness sakes, let’s at least get some lights on. DAVID strides over to some light switches. LIZ leaps up.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: David, wait- DAVID goes ahead and flips the switches. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Power's off.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: That’s a good thing. We don’t want to advertise our whereabouts more than we already have.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No of course not-

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Do we David?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, of course not Lizzy. I’m just trying to be pro- active. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have to face some facts here; the power and phones are off, there’s no sign of the owners and there’s a bloody great hole in the window.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You did that you twat!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Someone had to make a decision. I don’t know if you noticed but we were in a spot of bother back there. Somebody needs to take control of this situation and if no- one else is prepared to take on that responsibility, then perhaps I should. Nobody speaks. Again we hear the DISTANT MOANS.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Will Shaun be gone long?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: He’1l be back soon.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: How can you know that? How do we know he’s even coming back?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: I don’t think he’d leave us Daffs.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t he? Lizzy, are you really going to put your faith in a man who last night you spectacularly binned for, among other things, being unreliable? A man whose idea of a romantic nightspot and an impenetrable fortress are the same thing. A pub. We are in a pub. What the hell are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I could get a round in.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Will Shaun be gone long?  92.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Look, let’s just keep quiet and wait for Shaun. We can barricade the window when he gets back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Ok, then what? I mean how long are we going to be here? Hours? Weeks? What about food? What are we going to eat?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Toasties?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah, there’s a Breville out back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Phew, that’s okay then. Oh wait, there’s no power!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Shut up, we got plenty of bar snacks.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well as long as we’ve got nibbles, we're saved. That must be why Shaun dragged us here. Dragged us here and buggered off.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: He’s coming back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why, because he promised? Even if he does come back, do you really think his master plan will extend to anything more than sitting in the dark eating peanuts? He’s gonna stroll on in and make everything okay is he? He’s-

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I DON’T KNOW DAVID! I don’t know anymore than you do. What I do know is that we’re here now and we have to make the best of it. (takes a breath) Ed, get me adouble vodka.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Right you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’1l have one too actually. Would you like a drink Barbara?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, fuck it. Let’s all get bladdered shall we? Great idea. Why don’t we have some nibbles while we're at it? DAVID flounces behind the bar and rifles through boxes of snacks, before petulantly throwing them out into the loun

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've got Mini Chedders....

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: David-

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We've got Twiglets...

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Daffs-

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: ...we've got ‘Hog Lumps’... A HAND SNATCHES THEM FROM MID-AIR! A perfect catch.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Pickle?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Hello Mum. SHAUN IS BACK. Striding in from behind the bar. There’s s and delight from all but DAVID. SHAUN strolls over to LIZ

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything okay? SHAUN pops a Pork Scratching into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any sign of John and Bernie?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: We haven’t seen them.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Did you check upstairs? SHAUN goes to the back corridor and tries a door marked ‘PRIVATE’. He forces it a little. It won’t open.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: I think it’s locked.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What’s the phone situation?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Dead. Same as the power. SHAUN nods and takes stock. He offers LIZ the Scratchings

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Nice of you to join us.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Promised didn’t I? DAVID steps in.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: How did you lose them?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I just gave them the slip. It wasn’t too difficult. They’re not all that. SHAUN casually leans back against the bar.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So you haven’t been bitten then?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Do I look like I’ve been bitten? DAVID eyes SHAUN’s bloodstained shirt, suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (indicating stains) Look, this is all from earlier and this is from Philip.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: And what's that?  95.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Pen.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: And how did you get in?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: There is a back door. Through the yard. I tried to tell you before you went and smashed the window.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What stopped you?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: You went and smashed the window.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I wasn’t the one blowing our cover by having a tiff with my boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: He’s not my boyfriend. A freshly pulled pint slides down the bar into SHAUN’s ha

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Might be a bit warm. Cooler’s off.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Thanks babe. SHAUN takes a long swig. Everyone looks at him expectantl

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: So what’s the plan then?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Anybody want a peanut? The GANG sit in the dark, in their OPENING SCENE position their usual table, BARBARA is huddled nearby. Empty glass and mountain of empty snack packets on the table. Chairs tables are stacked against the doors and windows. The gen mood has soured. DAVID looks at SHAUN smugly.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about another drink?  96. Nobody does. SHAUN looks to the pool table.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about pool? Again, no response.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Probably a bit noisy...with the...uh ball release... SHAUN fiddles with his beermat.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ed, why don’t you do your ‘Clyde’?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (to the others) Have you ever seen ‘Every Which Way But Loose’? Ed does the most amazing impression.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: No it’s not.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yes it is. Come on, do it.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: But it’s brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You've built it up too much, now.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Go on, it’s funny.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Yes c’mon Ed let’s see it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah, come on.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I’m not a performing monkey. BARBARA leans forward and reads ED’s t-shirt.  97.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: “I got wood”. No-one speaks. A STREET LIGHT flicks on outside. SHAUN lo out.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: The power’s on.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’s not, I’ve already tried it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: But the grid isn’t out. It’s the fuses. I’1l just switch ‘em back on.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What about the lights?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes, we don’t really want to advertise our whereabouts more than we already have. We may as well put a sign outside saying ‘All You Can Eat’.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: I think there is one.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah, they do a buffet on Sundays.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: The lights operate on a separate circuit, I'll just flip the mains breakers so we can get the telly on. It’s quite simple David. SHAUN flashes LIZ a confident smile and heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN walks into the dim back corridor, past the door mar ‘PRIVATE’. We linger on the DOOR HANDLE for a moment... SHAUN finds the fuse box by the back door, the window of which looks out into BLACKNESS. He flips the switches.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s it!  98. Curious, SHAUN peers out into the dark. He finds the rele switch and flips on the garden light. ZOMBIES...LOTS OF THEM. SHAUN snaps off the light and yan down the door blind in a moment of panicked denial. He ru back to the bar, past the door marked ‘PRIVATE’. Unseen by SHAUN, the DOOR HANDLE now TWITCHES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN returns to the bar, slamming the back door behind h DIANNE stood on a bar stool, flipping through the channel the wall-mounted television. We see the message- ‘STANDBY FOR FURTHER INFORMATION’ -displayed on every single channel. Only the fonts differ The BBC, very austere, MIV, very funky etc. Everyone star at the TV with growing concern. ED sidles up to LIZ.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Liz, you got a quid?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Um...yeah. LIZ gives ED a pound. He thanks with a smile. She smiles back. ED goes off. SHAUN returns. She nods to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s never anything on is there? SHAUN says nothing. He looks ashen faced and guilty.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? SHAUN glances to the back door.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: We got a bit of a problem.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: They followed me.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I thought you said you gave them the slip?  99.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: ...Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Do they know we’re in here?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Well, we’ll just have to be extra quiet won’t we? SHAUN nods again, comforted...as LIZ goes ashen faced.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What? LIZ turns to see ED pop the quid into the FRUIT MACHINE.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Ed, No!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed, no! Too late. ED hits a button...and hits the JACKPOT. There cacophony of BELLS, BUZZERS and SPOOKY NOISES.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Turn it off!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Turn it off! SHAUN dives to the floor and flips the switch. SILENCE. Then from outside- TAP...TAP...TAP...Everyone looks to each other gravely. T become THUMPS. GROANS become audible. Noise builds. THUMP! THUMP! THUMP! The GANG draw together and listen. L puts a hand on SHAUN’s shoulder...ED puts a hand on BARBA shoulder...DAVID puts a hand on DI’s shoulder...JOHN THE LANDLORD puts a hand on DAVID’s shoulder!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiit! Everyone scatters as ZOMBIE JOHN LURCHES TOWARD THEM.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Where the hell did he come from?  100.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I don’t know but-

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY MERCURY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘Tonight, I’m gonna have myself a real good time, I feel ali-i-i-ive’ “Don’t Stop Me Now” by QUEEN starts up on the JUKEBOX.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Who the hell put this on?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: It’s on random!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Oh for fuck’s sake. The THUMPING builds. JOHN advances. SHAUN acts.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Right, Dianne, stay with Mum! DIANNE runs to move BARBARA out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: David, kill the Queen!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: The jukebox! DAVID looks madly around the base of the JUKEBOX.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Liz, Ed, grab something weapony. SHAUN looks around for blunt objects. ED points to the ba

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What about the rifle?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s not real!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: How about some cocktails?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  101.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: The flaming spirits. Drambuie, Sambuca, Brandy. Get a rag in. Light it. Woof!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I dunno, the whole place could go up.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What then? ZOMBIE JOHN IS UPON THEM. SHAUN knocks into the pool tabl

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: How about pool? Agreed. SHAUN vaults over the table, grabs THREE CUES and throws one to LIZ and ED. They tense up, ready for action

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay John. Time at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY MERCURY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘Having a good time, having a good time’. As ‘QUEEN’ kick off, the trio launch into action, whackin ZOMBIE JOHN with their cues (This is choreographed in suc way that the action corresponds with the song’s lyrics). DAVID, meanwhile, is having no luck with the jukebox.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I can’t find the switch!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Get the fuses! DAVID runs off to the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID sees the fuse box. Panicked, he hits everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pub lights FLASH, illuminating A SEA OF ZOMBIES.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN, LIZ and ED subject ZOMBIE JOHN to a volley of blow He catches ED’S CUE and BREAKS IT IN HALF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID desperately flicks more switches. The back yard lig comes on, throwing ZOMBIE SHADOWS onto the blind. DAVID freaks out and backs away, moving past the door marked ‘PRIVATE’ which is now slowly opening to reveal ZOMBIE BERNIE. In her slippers. DAVID yelps and retreats into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID slams the corridor door and barricades it with chai

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Why is Queen still on?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I couldn’t find the switch! ZOMBIE JOHN rounds on LIZ, pushing her backwards over a table. ED gives up his broken cue and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed!

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Two seconds!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (0.8)
dialogues.text: Shaun! LIZ gets back up, brandishing A FIRE EXTINGUISHER. She le it off in ZOMBIE JOHN’s face. When the gas clears, ZOMBIE JOHN’s face is iced with frost...but he keeps coming.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shaun! SHAUN turns. DIANNE plucks THREE DARTS from the dartboard She flings the first...IT WEDGES INTO A BAR POST. The second dart...HITS JOHN IN THE CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yes! The third...HITS SHAUN! He yelps in agony.  103.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shauny! SHAUN looks up. A DART PROTRUDING PAINFULLY FROM HIS HEAD ED is behind the bar, the RIFLE in his hands. He throws i through the air. Despite the pain, SHAUN catches it. He l at the rifle in frustration, then with one ALMIGHTY BLOW THE BUTT, sends JOHN’s head backwards into the JUKEBOX. SPARKS fly. QUEEN stops. JOHN drops...

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you shoot him man? SHAUN rounds on ED with the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Because it’s- BANG. The RIFLE goes off. SHAUN is THROWN BACKWARDS. OPTI SHATTER behind ED. His jaw drops...with joy.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I fucking knew it! What did I say? Big Al was right! SHAUN gets up, looks at the SMOKING RIFLE, then at ED.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Okay... (plucks dart from skull) ...but dogs can look up.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE WINCHESTER -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: DRAWS and CUPBOARDS are opened...SHELVES cleared...A BOX SHELLS is discovered... SHAUN has his work tie wrapped round his head. The rifle on the bar. The THUMPING from outside is louder than ever

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Anyone fired a gun before?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Oh yes.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Apart from Ed.  104.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm a pacifist.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Apart from David and Ed.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: (putting her hand up) I have.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Good. Where?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: In a production of ‘Lear’. All the military were played by women...it was a starter pistol.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s not really a serious qualification.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: We took it to the Edinburgh Festival.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Sorry, what’s Ed’s experience?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: He shot his sister in the leg with an air rifle.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: She asked me to.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: (to Shaun) I think you should do it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I think we should all do it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: How can five people operate one gun?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Look, none of us have any real experience, okay, and we’ve only got-  ED glances into the BOX OF SHELLS and shakes them.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Twenty nine.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: -twenty nine bullets-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Call them shells.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: -twenty nine shells, so we should work together on this. I need someone to help me reload and everyone else to keep look out. I’ll fire. As Bertrand Russell once said, “the only thing that will redeem mankind is cooperation”. I think we can all appreciate the relevance of that now.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Did you get that off the back of a beer mat?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Guinness, Extra Cold.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I won’t say anything. 105. CRASH! The barricade of tables by the broken window SHUDD

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: They definitely want to come in.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Liz, can you get Mum out of the way? Ed, get me some shells. David, Di, over here.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: (running past the gun barrel) Crossing. LIZ goes over to BARBARA, who still clutches the flowers leads her off. BARBARA focuses on LIZ and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Barbara?  106.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Do you want to come with me?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Oh yes, that would be lovely. It’s nice to meet you finally. Shaun's always talking about you.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: I’ve got something for you.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Barbara, I really ought to- BARBARA produces an ornate ring on a chain around her nec

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Shaun’s father gave me this. Shaun’s real father that is. Philip never minded. I’ve kept it for twenty years. LIZ smiles, unsure how to react.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want you to have it.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Barbara, me and Shaun have-

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: It’s only right. BARBARA pushes the ring into LIZ’s hand and winces. LIZ l down, a tissue protruding from BARBARA’s sleeve suddenly blushes dark red. LIZ pushes the sleeve up. Beneath the w of blood soaked tissues, is a LARGE BITE.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t want to say anything. I thought Shaun would be worried. SHAUN looks over to BARBARA and LIZ. Something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Here they come! CRASH. The barricade of chairs and tables topples. Hands at the curtains. SHAUN has no choice, but to fight.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Get behind me, get behind me.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: There’s one! DI points. A DEAD FACE peers into the bar. SHAUN takes ai

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Sorry, we’re closed! CLICK. Nothing. Everyone looks at the rifle. SHAUN shakes

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: That happened to me on stage.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Is it the safety button?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Cock it! SHAUN looks from ED to the rifle. He cocks it and fires B BANG! BANG! The ZOMBIE falls back pulling the curtains wi it. CRASH. The window in the right hand door goes. ZOMBIES CL TO GET IN. Dianne sees them first.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Over there!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Over where?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Three o’clock! The team SPIN AROUND as a unit. SHAUN fires, though his a is erratic. Another ZOMBIE clambers in at the first breac

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Ooh, over there...uh...quarter to twelve!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Keep it simple! BANG! SHAUN manages to take out the door ZOMBIES.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Top left. They all swing to the left. SHAUN pulls the trigger. CLIC

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Reload. ED feeds SHAUN two shells.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’m on it! SHAUN cocks and fires, HITTING A ZOMBIE IN THE HEAD. BANG

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Ooh nice shot.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Thanks. Let’s block up the window. DAVID and DI run to fix the fallen barricade.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take over a minute. SHAUN hands the rifle to ED and runs to BARBARA and LIZ.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s up? Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun, I’m so sorry. LIZ says nothing, she looks at BARBARA.  109.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Mum, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: I didn’t want to be a bother. SHAUN sees the blood.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh God, Mum, I don’t understand-

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: The man in his pyjamas...I didn’t want to say anything. I thought you'd be upset.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: No... ED sees SHAUN hug BARBARA. He hands the rifle to DIANNE.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Take over a sec. ED runs to the back of the room. DAVID peers after him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What the hell’s going on? (shouting to the others)

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Barbara’s hurt.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: I know first aid!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I know first aid!

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Take over a mo. DIANNE hands the rifle to DAVID and rushes over. She arri to see BARBARA lying feverish in SHAUN’s arms. ED stands around, unsure what to do. LIZ comforts SHAUN. DAVID sees hand on his shoulder and looks down to his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Shaun...

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Hold on Mum. You’re going to be fine.  110.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Shaun, I forgot to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: For what? BARBARA shows SHAUN the flowers. He is baffled for a mome

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: It’s been a funny sort of day... BARBARA starts to convulse.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus Mum. No, no, no... BARBARA’s breathing slows. SHAUN buries his face in her h CLICK-CLICK. All turn to see DAVID POINTING THE RIFLE AT BARBARA.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We have to deal with her.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Daffs!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: For Christ’s sake.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She’s going to come back.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: She’s not gone anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She’s gonna change.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: She’s my Mum.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She’s a zombie. SHAUN positions himself between BARBARA and the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Don’t say that!  111.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: David, stop it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Move away. I’m going to count to- SHAUN leaps up, GRABS A BOTTLE FROM THE TABLE AND SMASHES He holds the broken bottle to DAVID’s throat.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: DON’T POINT THAT GUN AT MY MUM!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun, come on now. ED pulls a DART from the bar and aims it at DAVID’s neck.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: DON’T POINT THAT GUN AT BARBARA!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Ed, don’t exacerbate things.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Well, this isn’t exactly fair.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Here. ED flips a POOL CUE from the floor and hands it to DIANNE She raises the CUE above ED’s head.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Um, thank you. ED smashes ANOTHER BOTTLE and holds it to DIANNE’s throat

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: S’okay. LIZ steps in, hands raised, affecting calm.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Can we just stop and think about this?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Tell him to put the gun down.  112.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Tell him to take the bottle away from my throat.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Oh grow up!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She’s going to change Lizzy. She’1l change and kill us all. You know I’m right. Your ex can’t seem to grasp that.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: That’s what this is, isn’t it? It’s me. (to Liz) He just doesn’t like me. He never has. He’s always hated me and now he wants to shoot my Mum.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She's not-

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: You’ve always looked down your nose at me. You never thought I deserved her. That I was good enough.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh, we all know you’re in love with Liz.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That is not true.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh yes it is!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to Dianne) It’s not true!

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What?!  113.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: I know you only hung out with me at college to get close to Liz and when she knocked you back, I was there to pick up the pieces. I’ve come to terms with that Daffs. Why can’t you? DAVID flushes red and stammers to LIZ.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Liz, I want you to know that my feelings for you are essentially-

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: (incredulous) David, please! There are slightly more pressing matters at hand here.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yeah, like the fact that ‘Daffs’ here is pointing a gun at my mother.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m not the one being unreasonable ‘Pickle’.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: For Christ’s sake, she’s not dead.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You said it yourself about your stepdad.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She’s finished. Stop being such a hypocrite!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: You’re the one who’s gone from Chartered Accountant to Charlton Heston!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m not a Chartered Accountant!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: You look like one!  114.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m a lecturer!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: You're a twat!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She’s not your Mum anymore! Any second now she’1l be just another zombie.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: We’re not using the ‘Z’ word.

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE
dialogues.text: The shouting excites the ZOMBIES clamouring to get in.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, I can see what David is trying to say...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Thank you Lizzy.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: ...even if he is being a twat.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Yup. DAVID fizzes with indignation.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: And Shaun...Shaun look at me...I can’t begin to imagine how hard this must be for you, but we can’t afford to fall apart. Shaun...babe, I know you don’t want to hear this but...

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhh. ..  115. BARBARA is standing upright, behind DAVID. Everyone stops the sound of her mournful whine. Her eyes are a milky whi skin a lifeless grey, face twisted, almost pleading. SHAU takes the rifle from DAVID and points it at her. His hand shake, his eyes fill with tears. His finger tenses.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You do it! Do it! BARBARA looks at DAVID, her expression twists into a scow ZOMBIE BARBARA hisses and LUNGES FORWARD.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Mum. BANG. DAVID is flecked with blood. ZOMBIE BARBARA drops. TOTAL SHOCK. SHAUN lets the rifle fall to the floor. Ever is speechless. DAVID takes off his glasses to clean them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well, I think we’re all agreed that you did the right thing there. DAVID replaces his glasses. CRACK! SHAUN punches him hard the face, sending him sprawling. DAVID rolls over, he now the rifle in his hands, HE POINTS IT AT SHAUN.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: (disgusted) David! CLICK...the rifle is empty. DAVID looks desperate and ashamed. Everyone else is appalled. SHAUN hasn’t flinched

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Right, I’m leaving.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Not staying here. DAVID walks to the BOLTED FRONT DOOR and starts to move t tables and chairs away. The NOISE outside RISES.  116.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: If you open that door, we won’t stand a chance.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What, and you will in here? DAVID begins UNLOCKING THE DEADBOLTS to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: David don’t. It’s suicide!

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I think you should go man.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We will. We can run. (picks up a broken pool cue) We can defend ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: What do you mean ‘we’?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What do you mean, ‘what do you mean we’?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: You don’t honestly think I’m going to go out there do you? Opening that door now would be a very, very silly thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So, you're staying here? With him?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Shaun didn’t-

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: After all he’s got us into!

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: (holding up her finger) Ah-ah. Shaun didn’t ask you-

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Dianne, how-

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: (explodes)

dialogues.speaker: LET ME FINISH
dialogues.text: (David shrinks back) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shaun didn’t ask you to come here. You came for the same reason I did. You didn’t know what else to do. Now, get away from that door this instant.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: But-—

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: DAVID crumples, the pool cue dropping from his hand. He s away from the door and slumps against the window in tears

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Dianne. I’m sorry Lizzy.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Maybe we’re not the ones you should be apologising to. DAVID turns to SHAUN, his face quivering with guilt.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Shaun. SHAUN nods. Silently accepting the apology.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Well done Daffs. That took guts- SMASH! DEAD HANDS BREAK THROUGH THE WINDOW! DAVID is pull back as ZOMBIES BITE DOWN ON HIS BODY. He screams in pain SHAUN, LIZ and DI try desperately to pull DAVID back, as is dragged outside and TORN TO PIECES. They attempt to keep hold, but fall backwards, to find themselves clutching David’s SEVERED LOWER LEG. The screa remainder of DAVID is being sucked into the hungry crowd.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Still holding David's leg, DIANNE gets up and runs straig to the front door; UNLOCKING THE FINAL DEADBOLT!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Di, don’t!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Di, don’t!  118. Too late. DIANNE opens the door and runs out to save Davi thrashing at the ZOMBIES with her boyfriend’s leg.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m coming Daffs! DIANNE is swallowed by the crowd, ZOMBIES quickly take he place. Lots of them. All shapes and sizes, all walks of l All ravenous. THE FLOODGATES ARE OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh dear.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Cocktails?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Do it! ED runs off. SHAUN grabs the RIFLE. LIZ grabs the shells. reloads and open fire at the encroaching tide of ZOMBIES. feeds him ammo as they slowly back up to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Heads! A FLAMING COCKTAIL sails over LIZ and SHAUN’s head and explodes over the door. It ignites the surrounding curtai and carpet. ZOMBIES fall back momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Keep ‘em coming. The front barricade FALLS, ZOMBIES dropping clumsily into room. Another COCKTAIL EXPLODES, holding them back. The BACK DOOR shifts. The barricade of tables and chairs fall. DEAD HANDS reach into the bar, grabbing ED’s neck.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Gun please? SHAUN spins and throws the rifle to ED, who catches it an blasts over his shoulder. The HANDS fall back, releasing Behind, a PIZZA DELIVERY ZOMBIE walks through the fire.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Ed! Over here! ED chucks the rifle to LIZ. She is unsure what to do; the PIZZA ZOMBIE’s head is protected by a helmet. Deftly, she smashes the visor with the gun butt and fires into the ho  119.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Smooth! SHAUN notices BARBARA’s body. He grabs his jacket and lay over her face, placing the flowers on top. BANG! The BACK DOOR gives. ED turns to see ZOMBIES pour i

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shaun! Look who it is!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Fuck a doodle doo. Leading the pack is the naked ZOMBIE PETE. ED tries to ig a COCKTAIL but his lighter won’t work.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Bitch! SHAUN sees that ED is in trouble and calls for the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: To me! LIZ chucks him the rifle. ZOMBIE PETE lunges at ED, hissi

dialogues.speaker: ZOMBIE PETE
dialogues.text: Uhhhhh.. .

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Don’t groan at me, you thick fuck. ED gets PETE in a headlock. But he is distracted by a HALLOWEEN RINGTONE trilling out from somewhere in the bar looks up to see a COMMUTER ZOMBIE holding his phone.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey that’s mine, you cheeky- ED screams as PETE BITES DOWN INTO HIS ARM. ED throws his head back in pain, making his neck available to the nearb ZOMBIE BERNIE, who takes a MASSIVE CHUNK out of it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Nooooc00000000! SHAUN takes aim at ED’s attackers but can’t get a clear s

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pete!!! Amazingly, PETE hears this and turns around to face SHAUN PETE’s dead eyes lock with SHAUN’s.  120.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said leave him alone! SHAUN blows PETE’s head clean off. He swings back to ED b can no longer see him. There are too many ZOMBIES between

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ed! The front of the pub is now wide open. LIZ fends off the increasing numbers with a HAT STAND. They’re everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun. Bar!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: But- LIZ bundles SHAUN behind the bar. They crouch down, kicki the back door shut and holding it with their feet.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ed! No answer.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ed! SHAUN peers back. He sees nothing but ZOMBIES.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: A HUGE SHAPE tumbles over the bar next to SHAUN and LIZ.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: What? ED is alive but badly bitten, his neck GUSHING BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I thought you were-

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Chuck us a cloth will you? SHAUN does so. ED presses the beer cloth to his neck. ZOM now fill the bar, having breached the first fire barricad

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get the brandy!  121. SHAUN grabs a bottle of brandy and offers it to ED.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not for me you tit. Smash it on the bar. SHAUN jumps up and smashes the bottle. He grabs his light and ignites the spirit. Flames rip along the bar, a new f wall erupts. SHAUN rejoins ED and LIZ, triumphant.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Where are the bullets?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Call them shells.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Where are the shells? SHAUN jumps up again to retrieve the shells from the bar. burns his fingers and crouches down again sucking his thu

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck it! Owww! Fuck it! ZOMBIES now reach through the flames, pushing at the pump Alcohol rains down. ED takes a few gulps.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, what are we going to do then? Where are we going to go? SHAUN and LIZ look round at a loss. Then- BANG. A FOOTBALL hits the back of the bar, smashing a mir It falls down and settles on the TRAPDOOR to the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: The cellar?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Maybe we can get out.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah, there’s the barrel hatch. That leads out into the street.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: You mean go back outside?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Which would you prefer, mortal peril or certain death?  122.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Um...first one. They head for the TRAPDOOR. But- The ZOMBIE IRISH SPINSTE drops over and gets to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh give us a fucking break! On the fiery bar, the BOX OF SHELLS suddenly explodes. St bullets fire off everywhere. One ricochets off the pub be and hits the ZOMBIE IRISH SPINSTER in the head. She falls disappointed. SHAUN, LIZ and ED make for the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull ED down into a dark cellar, filled with boxes a laundry. SHAUN grabs some piping from the floor and shove through the handle of the trapdoor, wedging it shut. ED slumps against the wall, the beer cloth already sodden with blood. LIZ grabs some linen from the washing line an uses it to bandage ED’s wounds. In the far corner of the cellar, a shaft of orange street light illuminates the outline of the BARREL HATCH.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I can see the street! He puts the rifle down and jumps up, hanging from the handles. The BARREL HATCH does not budge.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! SHAUN pulls frantically before dropping down. He tries ag desperately trying to force open the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: LIZ watches with an increasing air of disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Shaun.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: WHY WON’T IT OPEN?  123. SHAUN drops down again and slides down the wall, utterly defeated. He laughs grimly.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So that’s that then. We’re trapped. ‘Let’s go to the Winchester’. Who the fuck came up with that idea? (puts head in hands) Oh man, I’ve really ballsed this up. LIZ leaves ED and sits with SHAUN on the floor. The noise from upstairs is muffled, the cellar oddly quiet.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: No you haven't.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I have Liz. I’m useless. I couldn’t save us. I couldn’t save Di and David. I couldn’t even save my own mother. I should have been there. I can’t-

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t feel so responsible. You tried. You did something. That’s what counts. God knows where we'd be if you hadn’t.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I s'pose. The CELLAR DOOR SHAKES violently. LIZ and SHAUN look at i

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Do you think they’1l get through?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: How many shells have we got left?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Two. I guess we could take out a few of them. If they stand ina line.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I wasn’t thinking about them.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I know.  124. SHAUN looks around at the surrounding bottles and barrels

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can’t we just drink ourselves to death?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I don’t think we’ve got time. The CELLAR DOOR SHUDDERS again. SHAUN looks at the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: There’s only two shells. What about Ed?

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t mind being eaten.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: How are we gonna do this?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I suppose one of us has to go first.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Maybe one of us has to ‘do’ the other and then ‘do’ themselves.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Maybe you should ‘do’ me first. I’1l only muck it up if I have to ‘do’ myself. SHAUN briefly mimes this out, then shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I really don’t know if I’ve got it in me to shoot my mum, my flat-mate and my girlfriend all in the same evening.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What makes you think I’ve taken you back? The CELLAR DOOR buckles. The COPPER PIPE BENDS.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
