dialogues.text: Well, you don’t want to die single do you? They laugh and look deeply into each other’s eyes.  125.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Actually, I would like to be shot.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Besides, I’ve changed y’know? I haven’t had a fag since yesterday. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: He hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Maybe we should have one now. LIZ takes out a crumpled packet of cigarettes. SHAUN look shocked. LIZ smiles innocently.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You left them in my room.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: They were in the bin!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I was desperate.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Sneaky cow. They each take a cigarette. LIZ shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Aah, I won't say anything. SHAUN ignites his lighter. The flame illuminates A RED BU on the wall, above which is a sign reading... ‘WAY OUT’ SHAUN holds the lighter up to reveal an electric door mechanism. They were sitting on the SERVICE LIFT all alon He and LIZ exchange a look. They nod. A silent agreement. CRACK. The CELLAR DOOR splinters. DEAD FINGERS claw throu as the smoke thickens. They are almost inside. SHAUN runs to ED’s side. He is pale and visibly fading.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Come on. We’re leaving.  126.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I might just stay here.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: But we can all get out.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I think you two should make a go of it.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I’1l only hold you back. SHAUN looks at his friend and realises he’s right. With a somber nod, he offers ED the RIFLE. ED (CONT’D) Don’t you want it?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Nah. You have it. I can’t hit anything with it anyway. ED takes the RIFLE from SHAUN.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Ed.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I shouted at you earlier.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: S'alright. I’m sorry too.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: No, I’m sorry Shaun. SHAUN puzzles, before his expression turns to disgust. ED laughs. SHAUN winces, as he covers his nose and mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus. That’s not funny.  127.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I’1l stop doing them when you stop laughing.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: (welling up) I’m not laughing. The CELLAR DOOR finally gives. Smoke now pours through.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You better be off. SHAUN looks at ED. A silent goodbye. He joins LIZ on the SERVICE LIFT. She has found an old FIRE AXE and a LARGE CHAIN. SHAUN chooses the axe. LIZ hits the RED BUTTON. The service hatch opens. SHAUN and LIZ are bathed in oran streetlight. The lift starts to ascend.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Bye Ed. Love you.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: I love you too man.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Gay. ED disappears from view, lost amid the THICK SMOKE and th ENCROACHING MOANS, as SHAUN and LIZ reach-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAUN and LIZ rise up onto the street, a shot rings out f the cellar beneath. SHAUN and LIZ exchange a look. It’s j them now, versus an ARMY OF ADVANCING ZOMBIES.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Ready. They both raise their weapons, ready to fight on together The CHORUS OF MOANS is now deafening. But then- Another sound. An ENGINE ROARING, approaching fast.  128. SHAUN and LIZ are dazzled by BRIGHT HEADLIGHTS, as one of CONVOY OF MILITARY TRUCKS mounts the curb next to the Winchester, knocking several ZOMBIES flying. FIGURES leap from the back. ORDERS barked. SHOTS are fire SHAUN and LIZ are disoriented until they hear...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ohmigod! Shaun! A SMALLER FIGURE moves in front of the headlights. SHAUN squints into the glare.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Yvonne? YVONNE steps forward, her face becoming visible.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: How you doing? SHAUN and LIZ exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN LIZ
dialogues.text: Surviving. Surviving.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re taking us somewhere safe. Thought you might want to tag along. Is it just the two of you? SHAUN and LIZ nod somberly.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well...Glad somebody made it. YVONNE beckons SHAUN and LIZ towards the truck. With the sound of GUNFIRE and PITCH BATTLE echoing around them, th disappear into the BLINDING LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: CAPTION ‘6 MONTHS LATER’ ..-WHITE NOISE FLIPS TO... NEWS: The TROUBLED REPORTER from earlier. Now very calm a being interviewed as an authority on the subject. “,..these beings, these creatures or to use the correct scientific terminology...Zombies, posed the greatest thre  129. FLIP. We see footage of MILITARY POLICE racing down subur streets, saving people from houses. “,..it’s a testament to the combined forces of the milita that law was restored. Of course we now realise that the phenomenon resulted from the use of-" FLIP. A TRASHY AMERICAN DOCUMENTARY. Quick cut NTSC foota of zombies and shootings. “,...next we’ll hear the story of 10 year old Issac Baumg who fought off the reanimated corpses of his extended fam It’s all coming right up on ‘Zombies From Hell’.” FLIP. A SERIOUS DOCUMENTARY. “,..of course the fact that the mobile deceased still hav primal instincts and trace cognitive thought...” We see ZOMBIES herded into a cage on the back of a lorry. “,..makes them ideal recruitment for the service industry We see a ZOMBIE NOEL in overalls pushing shopping trolley “,..and because we now know the condition is caused by-” FLIP. A heated discussion on ‘Trisha’. A young woman is s on the stage. A corner graphic reads ‘I MARRIED A MONSTER

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: ...people say it’s wrong. But he’s still my husband, y’know? In the next chair to the young woman, sits a FIGURE in se darkness. TRISHA looks on sympathetically. YOUNG WOMAN (CONT’D) I still love him, still got the ring on me finger, Trisha... FLIP. A LAME GAME SHOW with lumbering undead contestants bouncy obstacle courses. An unseen commentator giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare feet lumber into shot. Slowly we PAN UP. SHAUN. His is tired, but happy. He yawns. We are back in the lounge. The room is tidy, but the deco little different. More homely. There are photos of Shaun Liz on the wall, next to two mounted rifles and posters advertising a club at which Shaun now Deejays.  130. We also see pictures of David and Di and Barbara and Phil arranged like little shrines. LIZ sits on the sofa, idly flicking through the cable channels. She is wearing BARBARA’S RING. SHAUN kisses her

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Allo.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Allo.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: So, what’s the plan then?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Right. We have a cup of tea. Then we go get the Sundays; head down The Phoenix for a roast; veg out in the pub for a bit; then wander back, watch a bit of telly and go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I’1ll get the kettle on.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Nice. Can I have two sugars?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Ooh, adventurous.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Just gonna pop into the garden actually.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Go on then.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Two secs.

dialogues.speaker: -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: SHAUN opens the repaired shed door. The interior is dimly by a flickering light. SHAUN sits down and picks up a gam controller, then presses a button. A VOICE booms.

dialogues.speaker: GAME VOICE
dialogues.text: Player Two has entered the game.  131. A ZOMBIE ED sits on the floor, playing a video game. He i shackled to the wall. ED turns to see SHAUN playing next him. He looks at him for a moment, before making a slow l at his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhh. SHAUN bats him away playfully.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: Ed! They continue playing. SHAUN scores a point. ED groans. S laughs.
